loans.name: Youness

texts.en: Youness is a 28-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and three working siblings. He strives to work really hard with the cooperation of his family in order to enrich their way of life and cover the heavy costs of living. Youness began his own work as a furniture painter in 2011. He has gained different clients from different areas especially because of his good and well organized work. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business in order to gain more customers and thus increase his income. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is the one responsible for them and the whole family is really thankful for what he did so far and will be going to do. Leila decided to start her own work as a photographer in 2009 and has opened her own studio. She is talented and works with a high professionalism. Today, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new scanner machine for her work in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own photography center.

loans.use: to purchase a new scanner machine for her work.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with two relatives. Regardless of his young age, Georges is doing the best he can to collect money and have his own family and children. For this reason, he decided to have his own business, so he opened a snack shop in his town in 2008. He’s a respectable person known for his good place and delicious food. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a freezer to be able to keep the food in good condition. In that way, he will gain people's trust and therefore, attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open his own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to be able to keep the food in good condition.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four working siblings. He’s doing the best he can to support his father in order to offer them a fair way of living. He has been working as a car painter since 2005 and has already had eleven years of experience. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the needed quantity of car paints and to renovate his garage. This will keep him up to date and offering good service to his customers. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage where he can serve more clients.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of car paints and to renovate his garage.

loans.name: Taisyr

texts.en:
Taisyr is 30 years old, a married man with two children who lives in Taiz, Yemen with his loving family. He has owned a bakery for 14 years. 

He started his business two years ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. He has attracted more clients and confined people. His business has continued running successfully and is more profitable. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he faces difficulty in the lack of gas leading him to sometimes have to close his business for a long time thus he has less profit from his enterprise and his customers are decreasing.

So he took a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy more bakery items such as flour, gas, etc. for his business in order to make bread and distribute it to many shops. 

 In the future, he hopes to expand his business to purchase another shop and make it a gas cylinder store and also buy a car for transporting his business items.

loans.use: to buy more bakery needs such as flour, gas, etc. in order to make bread to distribute to many shops.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is a 26-year-old man who is always kind-hearted in his everyday life, according to the residents of his neighborhood. He got married and has two children. The burden of supporting his family is becoming heavier than ever, as he needs to cover his children's expenses in terms of living, education, and other things required by a big family. 

Fuad started his business long ago in order to cover the expenses imposed by his big family. His business was initially decorating shop windows that didn't require a large amount of capital except to purchase white cement and equipment for adornment and carving of windows. This business achieved a good reputation in old Sana'a, where it is located, and many people became regular customers. 

Fuad's family life was somewhat improved by the limited income from that business, but he did not stop at this point. He had some thoughts about further enlarging his business by opening a cafe next to this business selling food to his clients, a commonly sold food eaten as breakfast. 

Fuad was in need of a loan to start up the other business and visited one of Al-Amal Bank's branches. He  took a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to pay the rent for the two shops and purchase needed materials like a large amount of white cement. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by opening a restaurant selling all types of food. He also hopes to build a house for his family and especially his children.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the two shops and purchase needed materials like a large amount of white cement for his business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 24 years old, a married man who lives  together with his parents who are from Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a general store for a long time on a stall in the town market in his area. He sells a variety of basic household products. He has managed to position his business in the market. It has a good reputation and is very accessible. It is a well-established business and many people come to it because they always find what they are looking for. He is very well-known and many people provide good references for him because he is noted for being an entrepreneurial man who is committed to his work. 

Ahmed has taken the decision to invest in his business so that he can keep it well stocked and attract more customers. This will allow him to increase his sales levels and his income, thereby enabling him to enjoy better living conditions.

Ahmed has decided to request a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to invest in his business, buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt and other products his customers would like. He hopes to expand his business to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to invest for his business, buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt, etc.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 23-year-old married man. He is the father of one child; he is working hard to provide him with the best living.

Amer has worked in fixing car bodies for 15 years; he started working when he was 8 years old. His childhood wasn't impressive at all since he didn't know the meaning of being a child.

In 2002, Amer started his own business. He started working in his house's backyard, and still does, but it has no rooftop. He really needs to build a roof in order to work easily during the winter season. He is using a plastic blanket to cover his working place, but it is impractical. That's why Amer applied for a  Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to build the necessary roof for his workplace.  

This is his first loan as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he believes that this loan will help him in expanding his business, increasing his income and providing his family with a good living and his child with a special loving and caring childhood.

loans.use: To build a necessary roof for his workplace.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом 1956 года рождения, у него 6 детей. Он работает пастух на ферме. Имея большой опыт скотоводства, он  дома также содержит скот овец, коз и корову. Его дети помогают в разведении скота.  Его невесты, весной начнут продавать молоко и молочные продукты. Абдусалом получил очередной кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. С каждого кредита он приобретает скот и вовремя сезона продав коз или овец, он улучшает свое благосостояние. За финансовую поддержку он благодарен Арванд и КИВА.
texts.en: Abdusalom was born in 1956. He has 6 children. Abdusalom is a herdsman on the farm. He is very experienced in livestock breeding, and there are sheep, goats and a cow on his farm. Abdusalom's children help him breed livestock. His daughters-in-law will start selling milk and dairy products in spring. Abdusalom got another loan to increase the number of livestock. The loans that he receives help Abdusalom purchase the livestock. He sells goats and sheep when market prices are high, and therefore makes a good profit.  Abdusalom thanks both MDO Arvand, LLC and KIVA for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 25-year-old married woman. Six years ago, Hanan started her own business from her house. She works as a hairdresser and most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

Her business is improving, but she has to put much effort in developing it to open her own future dream beauty salon. That's why Hanan applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary tools and equipment for improving her business.This is her second loan with Al Majmoua. Her previous loan helped a lot in supporting her business.

Hanan started her business from home because she didn't have enough capital to open a salon. She was trying to prove that when there is a will there is a way. She confirms that she was right and she will continue working on improving and developing her business to keep her customers pleased.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man. Five years ago Mohamad started his own business, dealing with manufacturing aluminum doors, closets & windows. He was too young to start a business, but he had his family to take care of and to help in making their living.

Mohamad is a hard worker, he insists on improving himself as much as he can. That's why he has applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials with special prices. 

Mohamad misses his childhood and hopes to expand his business in a way that when he thinks of making a family in the future, he has to be sure that his children will have a safe and healthy childhood with all their needs to be met. Mohamad insists on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials with special prices.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икрому 32 года, он женат. У него молодая семья, поэтому он должен хорошо зарабатывать, чтобы прокормить не только свою жену, но и помогать своим родителям пенсионерам.  Для этого они с отцом занимаются разведением коз. Их кишлак небольшой и основной работы у них нет. В основом многие едут в Российскую Федерацию и Казахстан, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Икром как и все ездил в Россию и присылал своим родителям деньги и даже копил на свадьбу. Теперь после свадьбы он по совету отца выводит скот для продажи на местный рынок. Настоящий кредит получает для покупки скота.
texts.en: Ikrom is 32 years old and married.  He has a young family and, hence, has to earn well in order to provide not only for his wife, but to help his retired parents.  This is why, his father and he are involved in breeding goats.  Their village is small, and they do not have a primary job.  Many people mainly go to the Russian Federation and Kazakhstan in order to provide for their families.  Ikrom went to Russia, just like everyone else, and sent money to his parents and even saved for the wedding.  Now, after the wedding, he, per his father's advice, takes livestock out for sale to the local market.  Ikrom is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client and is 29 years old, married, and has two children.

Ammar has been an owner of a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, dairy products, and household items. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to make an aluminum showcases and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an aluminum showcase for his storefront and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Seif Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 20-years-old. He is single and lives with four family members; two of them work.

Seif has been an owner of a shop selling perfumes since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for $2400 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Meshreq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is a youth client who is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Meshreq has been a carpenter since 2005; he makes living room, bedroom and all types of furniture.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation.  His workshop is located in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 youth loan in order pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years old and married.

Mahmoud has been a tailor since 2008; he makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $1500 youth loan in order to purchase a split air conditioner for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner for his workshop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has one child.

Ali is an owner of a shop since 2011, selling women’s clothing and accessories. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1800 loan in order to make glass showcase and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to make glass storefront and to add more goods.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. 24 years old, he is a youth client. He is single and lives with six family members, two of whom work.

Hussein has owned an electric generator since 2009. He leases electric lines for his area and surroundings. He has sufficient experience in this field and is well known for his good reputation in his area.

He decided to apply for a 2,500 USD youth loan to renovate the room for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate the room for the generator.

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.ru: Амбарой женщина средних лет,занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 20ти лет и торгует женской и детской обувью на рынке.Имеет постоянную торговую точку и своих клиентов.Закупает товар по оптовой цене в оптовом рынке и продает по доступной цене.Более трёх лет кредитуется в нашей организации и начала с маленького оборота.Постепенно  расширилась и зарабатывает на жизнь стабильно.Хотя у Амбарой есть сыновья и муж,которые работают, она нуждается  в своих ресурсах ,так как у неё бывает много семейных расходов по проведению всяких мероприятий и она не хочет обременять своих сыновей.Она рада что работает с нами и всегда  рассчитывает на нашу поддержку в нужную минуту.
texts.en: Ambaroy is a middle-aged woman who has been engaged in business for over twenty years, selling women's and children's footwear. She maintains a permanent outlet at the market, and has regular clients. Ambaroy purchases her merchandise at a bulk price at the wholesale market, and resells it at affordable prices. She has been taking loans from MDO Arvand, LLC for over three years, having started with small-volume sales. Gradually, she expanded her business and now makes a stable income. Although Ambaroy has a husband and sons who are employed, she needs her own resources to cover the numerous family expenditures related to various events, as she does not want to burden her sons. She is glad to be working with MDO Arvand, LLC and always counts on their support in time of need.

loans.use: to buy a new lot of goods for her shop

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, 23 years old, and married.

He has owned a grocery since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan in order to renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Lobiko Plus Group

texts.en:
Julienne, aged 60, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank “Lobiko Plus”, which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julienne has been in business for years. She sells fresh food at the market located north-east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received seven different loans and has repaid them properly. As the fresh food demand is high in her community, she intends to use the next loan to increase her stock of fresh food, reselling it with the aim of increasing her profits. Each month, her business brings in a profit of US$300. 

Her ambition is to someday become a fresh food wholesaler in her environment. Julienne is a widow and has five children, who are aged between 20 and 30 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the fresh food’s stock and reselling at profit

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 27 years old, married and has three children.

Hussein has been a tailor since 1990. He makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally including suits, coats and trousers for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 23 years old, single and lives with eight family members.

Alaa has been an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to purchase an electrical generator for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his market.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old, is married and has two children. He lives with his family.

Raed has owned a furniture gallery since 2000, selling sofas, tables and bedroom furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for his gallery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his gallery.

loans.name: Dalia Group

texts.es:
Valentina cuenta con 49 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene un hijo que esta estudiando la preparatoria 1° grado su esposo se llama Carmelo es campesino, ella se dedica al comercio vende frutas y verduras ya tiene 4 años con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras como son: manzana, cebolla, chiles, jitomate, lechuga, naranjas, etc.  Doña valentina dice que le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas ella dice que esta trabajando para sacar adelante el negocio y su familia espera que el negocio incremente ya que ella esta haciendo el mayor esfuerzo.

Valentina pertenece al grupo dalia el cual esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Humberta, Areli, Abida, Faustina, Sandra, Liobarda, Irene, Lourdes, Eladia, Gerarda, Valentina, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de frutas, verduras, quesos, abarrotes, comida, pollos, plástico, etc.
texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old and lives with her partner Carmelo and son who is a student at a school for adults. Carmelo is an agricultural worker.

Valentina earns a living by selling fruit and vegetables such as apples, onions, chiles, jitomate, lettuce, and oranges. She says she would like her business to grow a little more. She and her family want to see her business do well as she is working hard to make this happen. 

She belongs to the Dahlia group which has eleven members. All are hardworking women. Their names are Humberta, Areli, Abida, Faustina, Sandra, Liobarda, Irene, Lourdes, Eladia, Gerarda, and lastly Valentina herself. They run businesses such as selling fruit, vegetables, cheese, groceries, food, chickens, and plastic goods.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables such as apples, onions, chiles, jitomate, lettuce, and oranges

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad de 33 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa e hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar terneros para su posterior engorde. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la explotación de estos animales y así poder sacarlos en un tiempo rápido para la venta. El con estos animales quiere generar el máximo de las ganancias a la hora de la venta para mejorar su nivel de vida y su estabilidad económica para su bienestar familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Miguel is 33 years old and in a live in relationship.  He lives with his partner and children who are his top priority.  He will use the money from this loan to buy steers that he will fatten up.  He has the land on which to raise these animals and will be able to sell them quickly.  He wants to maximize his earnings with these animals so that he can improve his quality of life and financial stability for his family’s well-being.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous conventional loans, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо женщина , которая помогает мужу по откорму скота. Она живёт вместе со своим сыном у которого жена и двое детей. Сам на заработках в России. Хуринисо каждый день выводит своих коров на пастбище пастись, а вечером заводит и доит их молоко. Она имеет не большой доход от продажи молока, пока у неё две коровы. На полученный кредит она хочет купить ещё пару  молодых коров и откормив в зимний период, продать за хорошую цену. Она благодарна организации и инвесторам за финансирование и понимание.
texts.en:
Huriniso assists her husband in their cattle-fattening business. She lives with her son's wife and two children, while the son is away working in Russia. Every morning, Huriniso takes out the cows to graze and then brings them back in the evening for milking. Because she owns only two cows, money, generated from selling the milk, is low. 
Receiving a loan would allow get to purchase a couple of cows, fatten them during winter, and then sell with profit. She thanks the organization and investors for financing and assistance.

loans.use: to fatten cattle.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим мужчина 33 лет, отец пятерых детей. Он живёт в пригорном районе, где мужчины в основном занимаются и имеют доход на жизнь от бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. А также по профессии Иброхим сам дехканин, он выращивает арахис и продаёт его оптом торговцам. Но сейчас на полученный кредит он планирует купить несколько голов баранов и коз. Он уже второй раз получает кредит и он благодарит, что благодаря кредиту он смог увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is thirty-three years old and the father of five children. He lives in a mountainous region, where men have historically made a living by fattening, breeding and selling cattle. Ibrohim also works on a collective (dekhan) farm, where he grows arachis and sells it in bulk. 
A loan would allow him to purchase several heads of sheep and goats. This is his second loan and the thanks everyone that helped him receive his first loan. With it, he was able to increase his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Saidhomid

texts.ru: Саидхомид занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает газированные напитки и натуральные соки. Ему 33 года. Торговлей Саидхомид занимается пять лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для покупки других видов натуральных соков, колы и спрайта.
texts.en: Saidhomid is in retail business. He mainly sells sparkling drinks and natural juices. He is 33 years old. Saidhomid has been in this business for five years. He is married and has four children. He is taking out the loan to purchase a variety of natural juices and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of natural juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rossanna Vanessa

texts.es:
Rossanna Vanessa tiene 28 años es casada, vive con el esposo y con un hijo de 5 años. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

La señora Rossanna Vanessa se dedica al negocio de Yambal, es decir a la venta de cosméticos por medio de revistas y a dar asesoría de belleza.El credito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de Yambal para el negocio

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil por medio de correo electrónico. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Rossanna es aumentar el negoció, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la televisión y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Rossanna Vanessa is 28 years old and lives with her husband of five years in the Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos settlement.

The EL SAGRADO CORAZON neighborhood, located in the area of the intersection of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre streets is part of the Ventanas settlement.  This is an area of merchants.

Rossanna Vanessa is a businesswoman and sells Yambal products; that is cosmetics through catalogs.  She also gives beauty advice.  She will use the money from this loan to Yambal products for her business.
 
She will order her supplies through email from the city of Guayaquil.  The loan has helped her increase her productivity and have quality products.  Rossanna’s dream is to grow her business.  She’s faced challenges such as high prices and competition.

In her spare time she likes to watch television and go for walks in the woods.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar, tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal, como lo son el abono y los químicos necesarios. El cuenta con un área muy buena ya sembrada de café y lo que quiere es asistirla para mejorar la producción este próximo año. El tiene como meta aumentar su cosecha  y generar más ganancias para tener un futuro más estable económicamente y mejor bienestar familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Omar is 58 years old and married.  He lives with his wife, and she is his greatest priority.

He will use the loan to buy supplies to care for his coffee crops.  He will buy things he needs like natural and chemical fertilizers.  He has a very good area that has already been planted with coffee.  What he wants to do is care for the crops in order to improve production this coming year.

His goal is to increase his harvest and to generate more income.  He wants to do this in order to have a more stable financial future and to improve his family’s daily well-being.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans with state banks.  However, FUDESCOSUR has given him a loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.ru: Tofiq razvodit skot vo dvore svoego doma dla prodaji masya na bazare. Tak on zarabativaet dengi I soderjit svoyu semyu. Emu 58 let, on jenat, u nego dvoe detey I dva vnuka. On zanimaetsa etim 20 let, na segodnashniy den u nego odna korova I bichok. Tofiq xochet dengi dla postroyki kuxni I vannoy komnati u seba doma. Iza otsustviya udobstv v dome ego semye prixoditsa ne legko. Emu nujno 1000 AZN dla remonta.
texts.en: Tofiq has a corral outside his house. He raises cattle and sells the meat at the market.  By doing this, he makes a living and provides for his family. Tofiq is 58 years old, married, has two children and two grandchildren. He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. As of today, he owns one cow and a calf. Tofiq would like to get money to build a kitchen and a bathroom in his house. Life without conveniences is very difficult for Tofiq and his family. Tofiq needs 1,000 AZN for the repairs.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and a bathroom in the house.

loans.name: Carlos Virgilio

texts.es:
Carlos Virgilio  tiene 56  años es casado, vive con la esposa tiene 4 hijos todos son mayores de edad y no vive con él. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

El señor Carlos Virgilio se dedica al trabajo de Ebanista, es decir a la confección de muebles de madera.necesita el credito para la compra de madera, clavos y tapìs para los muebles.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señor Juan Arevalo. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Carlos Virgilio es tener un negocio más grande, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos de madera que es la materia prima.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y ver la televisión
texts.en: Carlos Virgilio is 56, married, and lives with his wife and 4 children, who are all adults living independently. He lives in the Ventanas district of Los Rios Province.  The EL SAGRADO CORAZON group is located on calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, in Ventanas district and is engaged in sales. Carlos Virgilio works making wood furniture.  He seeks credit to buy wood, nails and cloth for furniture.  He buys these items in the city of Ventas from Juan Arevalo.  He seeks this loan to increase production and make quality products.  His dream is to grow his business, and he confronts challenges such as the high cost of his prime material: wood.  In his free time, Carlos Virgilio enjoys sports and watching TV.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and cloth for furniture

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo es soltero, tiene 19  años de edad, Ricardo   estudia Contabilidad  en una universidad privada de prestigio, Ricardo escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, Su sueño de Ricardo  es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por él, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y  prácticas profesionales, Ricardo cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Young Ricardo is single and is 19 years old. Ricardo studies accounting in a prestigious, private university. Ricardo chose this career since it is his vocation and he has the capacity and ability to develop himself professionally. Ricardo's dream is to provide his parents a better quality of life and, in some way, give them back everything they have done for him. With the goal of continuing to grown, he has requested a new loan to pay his tuition and professional exams. Ricardo will accomplish his goal with a lot of work and effort that the Edaprospo loans help him with.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and professional exams.

loans.name: Josimar Emilio

texts.es:
Josimar Emilio G. C. tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

Josimar se dedica a la comercialización a la compra y venta de carne de res, las compras las realiza en Santo Domingo y los vende todos los días en el local de su casa. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Josimar Emilio G. C. is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. He doesn't have any children.

The “Sagrado Corazón” (Sacred Heart) communal bank is located on Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre streets.  It is in the Ventanas canton, and this communal bank devotes itself to commercial activities.

Josimar buys and sells beef. He makes his purchases in Santo Domingo and makes his sales every day from his home. He is requesting this loan to buy products and have them in a store. The support of this loan will help to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges in his business such as competition and high prices. His dream is to expand his business.

Josimar enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to acquire products and have them in a store.

loans.name: Santo Carlos

texts.es:
Santo Carlos tiene 43 años vive en Union Libre, vive con la esposa y un hijo de 7 años. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

El señor Santo Carlos  se dedica a la venta de Tercena, es decir a la venta de carne de res o mas conocida como la carne de vaca. Necesita el dinero para invertir en la carne.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señora Julia Moreno. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Santo es seguir en el negocio, ha enfrentado desafíos como la competencia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar.
texts.en: Santo Carlos is 43 and lives with his common-law wife and his 7-year old son.  He lives in the district of Ventanas, in Los Rios province.  The EL SAGRADO CORAZON group is located at Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, in Ventanas district and the group is engaged in sales. Santos Carlos Virgilio works selling beef from cattle, known asTercena. He needs capital to invest in buying meat. He buys his products in the city of Ventas, from Julia Moreno. This loan will allow him to increase production and produce quality product.  Santos hopes to grow his business, and has faced challenges such as competition.  In his free time, he enjoys resting.

loans.use: invertir en la carne.

loans.name: Idalia Maria

texts.es:
Idalia, soltera, abogada de profesión labora para una empresa del estado, en la cual trabaja desde hace un tiempo como docente, recibe mensual una suma de dinero por parte del padre de sus hijos, así también percibe otros ingresos por sus servicios profesionales como abogada. 
Sus planes son mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, ofreciéndole así a su familia mayor comodidad y seguridad.  Esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de: bloques, quintales de hierros, estribo, alambre de amarre, clavos de maderas, clavos de acero, tablones, cementos, caja de soldadura, perlines, arena, piedrines, piedras canteras, puerta de madera preciosa, inodoro, lava mano, laminas de zinc, cerámica entre otros materiales para realizarle cambio de techo a una parte de la casa, también construir un cuarto realizando divisiones de individualidad para sus hijos y construir el baño. Obteniendo mayor higiene y alejando las enfermedades. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de sus planes y proyectos.
texts.en: Idalia, a single lawyer by profession, works for a state company where she has worked for some time as a teacher. She receives a sum of money monthly from her children's father. She also receives other income for her professional services as a lawyer. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house, offering her family greater comfort and security. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of blocks, quintals of iron, stirrups, tie wire, nails, wood, steel nails, planks, cement, welding box, beads, sand, stone, quarry stone, hardwood door, toilet, basin, sheets of zinc, ceramics among other materials to change the roof of a part of the house and to also build a room so she can make individual rooms for her children and build a bathroom, securing better hygiene and preventing illness. She is thankful to the financing organization for the support to develop her plans and projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to change the roof and build a room.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is 52 years old,  married, and has one child who is studying at the university. She and her husband, who is working out of the country, combine to support their child and pay his school fees.  

In 2008, Samia opened her own snack shop in her town where people meet and enjoy eating. She is well known for her good food. She is requesting a loan from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to renovate her snack shop. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to renovate her snack shop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 4 years old. All five of them go to school. 

Rebecca runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for five years. She has no employees. Rebecca heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well on a radio station advertisement. 

She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items like cassava flour, maize grains, and many others. In additions to this business; Rebecca has small houses for rent as another source of income.

In five years' time, Rebecca hopes she will be able to change the small houses into concrete buildings.  

Her major challenges include home expenses at the moment only.
 
Rebecca says that she really appreciates Finance South Sudan for good work done.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cassava flour, maize grains, and many others.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and five children; one of them is working. He’s looking to support his family the best he possibly can.  That’s why he started to work in the construction field since 1987. He’s specialized in floor covering and building decoration using stones. Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a generator for his business. He notes that this will develop his business and it will return higher earnings. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for his business

loans.name: Abdel Salam

texts.en: Abdel Salam is a 47-year-old man. He is married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He has been working as a supervisor in a local company since 1998.  He is an expert in his field and is looking to further grow his business. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees.  This Kiva loan will allow them continue their education and move to the university. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better support them.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her late brothers’ children).  

Rehema has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She also generates additional income through selling firewood.

The main business challenges for Rehema include defaulters, seasonality, and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler, start going to villages for sweet bananas, and also to build her own house.  Rehema lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Susy Geovanna

texts.es:
Susy Geovanna J. C. tiene 36 años, vive en union libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

Susy se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y comprar una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta arreglar la casa.
texts.en: Susy Geovanna J. C. is 36 lives with her common-law husband and children in the Ventanas district of Los Ríos province. She has three children. The group EL SAGRADO CORAZON is located in the Ventanas district, at the crossroads of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre. This group works selling cosmetics, taking catalog orders by phone. She then sells them door to door. She is asking for this loan so that she can order the products from the catalog and have them available in a store. This loan will help her meet her needs financially. She faces challenges like competition and high prices. Her dream is to purchase a vehicle and a house. In her free time, she likes to take care of her home.

loans.use: to order products from a catalog and have them available in a store

loans.name: Premio Mayor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PREMIO MAYOR” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Adelaida. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de queso, artesanía de mantas, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, confección de polleras, venta de artefactos, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Adelaida,  indica que hace veinte y dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su tía. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo el mismo de su madres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de de Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido en tiendas e instituciones. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Premio Mayor Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II program. There are eight members in the group which is led by a committee headed by Sra. Adelaida. The members run various businesses such as selling cheese, making shawls, selling soft drinks, making and selling skirts, selling artifacts, food and groceries. 

Sra. Adelaida has worked with Pro Mujer for 22 years, starting with the organization at the invitation of her aunt. Currently she has a corner store which she began some time ago after learning how to run a store from her mother. The loan she will receive this time is to be used to buy more supplies which she will obtain in Peru and then sell to stores and institutions. Her job enables her to support her family--she is married and has four children.

When Adelaida is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Mary  has a business selling   bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Mary sells her products at the market, retail.

Mary  has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Mary  include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. 

Mary  lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 23-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 1 and 4 years old. He describes himself as patient and focused. 

George operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a cow to slaughter for meat. His business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter for meat.

loans.name: Ayero,

texts.en:
Ayero is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. he is married with two children, 9 and 4 years old. Both of them go to school. 

Ayero runs a mixed goods store, and he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Ayero heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well through a promotion done in the market by the officers.

He is taking a loan of 2500 SDG to purchase more items like batteries, sweets, strainers, and many others. In addition to this business, Ayero has small houses for rent as another source of income.

In five years' time, Ayero would like to hope for building better houses. His major challenge is his low income rate only.
 
Ayero says that he really appreciates Finance South Sudan for good work done and God bless the company!

loans.use: to purchase more items like batteries, sweets, strainers, and many others

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es:
Doña Mayra sigue laborando para el bienestar comun de la familia, como docente, y como objetivo ha sido el mejoramiento de su pequeña casa, su esposo continua trabajando en diseño, y para el las mejoras son el bienestar de su familia, el cual ya tienen un hijo nacido de meses.
Con este nuevo prestamo continuara cerrando todo el terreno, ya que la parte de enfrente la cerro con muro, ahora desea seguir con la parte de atrás, siendo el terreno grande, el cual tiene que ir poco a poco, ya que no cuenta con todo el capital, aparte que tiene que cubrir la canasta basica, gastos de agua, luz, salud entre otros. se siente contenta por estas mejoras que gracias a los financiamiento se esta haciendo posible a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Mayra continues working as a teacher for the common well-being of her family. With that objective, she has been improving her little house. Her husband still works in design. For him also the improvements are for the welfare of the family, which now includes a son, born just months ago.

With this new loan, Mayra will continue enclosing their land. The front part already has a wall and now, they want to continue the wall in back. The lot is large and they have to enclose it little by little, since they lack the necessary capital. In addition, she has to cover the basic food basket, and the cost of water, light, and health, among other expenses. Mayra is happy about these improvements which, thanks to these loans, are becoming possible in the short term.

loans.use: continue constructing a wall at the back of her lot, for a safer future.

loans.name: Ingrid Giannina

texts.es:
Ingrid Giannina  tiene 24 años es casada, vive con el hijo de 2 años  y el esposo. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

La Señora Ingrid  se dedica a la venta de Pan es la un local de la casa propia las cosas que necesita para realizar este producto lo comprar el Comercia Yolita y los vende en la casa. necesita el dinero para la comprar de harina , manteca, levadura, huevos, sal y queso.

El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Ingrid es seguir en el negocio, ha enfrentado desafíos como la competencia y la suba de precios en la harina que es la materia prima.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con los hijos y con el esposo.
texts.en: Ingrid Giannina is 24 and lives with her husband and 2-year old son. She lives in the district of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. The EL SAGRADO CORAZON group is located at the crossroads of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, in Ventanas district and the group is engaged in sales. Ingrid Giannina works selling bread. She buys products needed for baking from the Yolita store and sells them from her home. She plans to use the credit to purchase flour, shortening, yeast, eggs, salt and cheese.  This loan will allow her to increase production and produce quality product. Ingrid Giannina hopes to continue her business, and has faced challenges such as competition and increased prices for her main ingredient, flour. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, shortening, yeast, eggs, salt and cheese

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is married and has one child who is six months old.  He operates a retail store where he sells items such as bread, milk, sugar, and rice, which he has been doing for 11 years. His business is located in a densely populated  area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Japhet is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more products to sell.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving his shop. Japhet's  business goal is to run a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future he will run a fully stocked shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is married and has four children who range in age from 7 to 20 years old. He describes himself as diligent, and has for the last five years earned a living by running a carpentry shop where he sells furniture. His business is in a good location, and his main customers are schools and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving his carpentry shop. He will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy lumber. Shadrack's business goal is to run many more carpentry shops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create job opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy more lumber.

loans.name: Bella Alegria

texts.es:
Bella Alegria tiene 38 años es soltera, vive con una hija y con un hijo, es madre soltera. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

La Señora Bella Alegría se dedica al negocio de Yambal , es decir a la venta de cosméticos por medio de revistas y a dar asesoría de belleza.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil por medio de correo electrónico. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Bella es tener su propio negocio, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.


En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de visita donde la mama.
texts.en: Bella Alegria is 38, is single and lives with her two children in the Ventanas district of Los Ríos province. The EL SAGRADO CORAZON group is located at the crossroads of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, in Ventanas district and the group is engaged in sales. Bella Alegria sells Yambal cosmetics from mail-order catalogs as well as costume jewelry.  She orders her products by email from sources in Guayaquil. This loan will help her increase production and offer quality products for sale. Bella Alegria dreams of having her own business, and has faced challenges such as competition.  In her free time, she enjoys visiting her mother.

loans.use: to purchase products from mail-order catalogs

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a  Kiva borrower who has five children who range in age from 2 to 17 years old. He describes himself as honest and has, for the last seven years, operated a retail store where he sells charcoal. His business is located in a highly populated market area and his primary customers are schools and residents. He describes his biggest challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use this Kes. 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Jeremiah's business goal is to run a well-stocked retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of charcoal to schools.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Toloa

texts.en:
Toroa is a thirty-four-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married with four children between the ages of twelve and four. All four of them go to school. 

Toroa runs a food store business, and she has been in this business for three years. She has no employees. Toroa heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 600 SDG to purchase more items like tomatoes, onions, and many other products. Aside from this business Toroa has no other source of income. In five years time, Toroa hopes to have a big food store in the same market because it moves goods faster. 

At the moment, her major challenges include school fees and home expenses, because everything is expensive in Juba. Toroa says that she is happy for Finance Sudan's support in improving her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase more items like tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a single woman. She has a daughter who is nine years old. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits such as bananas and kale of different types. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located at a strategic market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase land.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as kale and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Aureria

texts.en: Aureria is a single woman. She has two children, 24 and 26 years old. She describes herself to be clean and intelligent. She operates a chemist's shop where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds and insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more medicine to sell. Her business goal is to have her own spacious business premises within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a young woman who is single and has no children yet. She describes herself as ambitious and optimistic, and operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been in this business for one year, and operates from a good location where most of her customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest challenge as the high price of cereals. She will use this Kes. 20,000 loan to buy more cereal to sell to her customers. Her business goal is to run a wholesale cereal shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 2 Group

texts.en:
Ceferino is the coordinator of his group "Plan de Lucha" (Battle Plan), group 2, and his story is representative of his group members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area so most of our loans are dedicated to the agriculture sector. Ceferino is running a butcher shop; other members in this group are breeding cattle, working the land, selling animals, etc.

Ceferino makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their five children. Ceferino is excited to be taking his 15th loan with Esperanza after successfully repaying his previous loans and growing his business. He plans to use this loan to purchase a cow and pigs; he sells meat in the local market in his community. He will use the profits to provide for family expenses and to reinvest in his business. His long term goal is to have a little farm where he can raise animals and sell them. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two to nineteen. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a retail stall  where she sells plastic items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a market place and her primary customers are local residents that come to the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high price of plastic. 

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more plastic items. Joyce's business goal is to expand her business and run another retail stall within five years.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Tamba Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, to apply for a loan of SLL 5,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group of borrowers. The forty-four-year-old is a native of Yendu village, in Eastern Sierra Leone. A teacher for twelve years now, Tamba is married to another teacher and the couple has five children attending secondary schools. 

Tamba has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials: iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Kimanthi

texts.en: Kimathi is a married man. He has a son who is 12 years old. He describes himself to be a courageous man. He operates a retail store where he sells jewelry. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a competitive area, and his primary customers are white people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy raw materials for making jewelry for selling. His business goal is to run a bigger retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is a 34-year-old married mother of four. Carmela is loving towards her family and friendly towards others. She has been raising and selling chickens and sheep since she was 12. She has been working hard for years with the help of her children. She hopes to provide a better quality of life for them. Her goal is to purchase more animals in order to increase her sales. Her hope for this, her first loan, is that it will help her expand her business. With the added income, she can save enough to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy chickens and sheep

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida est une femme battante, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 belles jeunes filles et deux garçons. L’ainé a 26 ans et le tout dernier, 5 ans qui va à la garderie d’enfants du quartier. Elle a 45 ans et parait plus jeune que son âge. Son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires chez elle ou elle à ouvert une cantine depuis 10 ans maintenant. Avec le crédit elle veut renouveler son stock qui a été volé. Elle va surtout acheter du riz, de l’huile, du lait qui sont les denrées les plus utilisées et les plus rapides  à écouler. Elle compte sa clientèle  parmi son entourage qui aime bien cette vente à proximité très pratique. Elle n’a pas de charges imposées sinon que ce qu’elle a envie de faire concernant son foyer. Et cela fait qu’elle a toujours besoin de diversifier les produits et services pour son commerce dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Aida is a woman with a fighting spirit. She is married and the mother of 5 children; 3 beautiful young girls and 2 boys. The oldest is 26 years old and the youngest is 5 and goes to the local daycare. Aida is 45 years old and looks younger than her age. She has a business selling groceries from her home, in which she opened a small store 10 years ago.

Aida wants to use the loan to renew her stock, which was stolen. She will buy grocery products, particularly rice, oil and milk, which are the most well used and the quickest to sell. Her customers are people who live in her environment and who like the convenience of being able to shop locally.

Aida has no financial obligations except for the household ones which she wants to contribute to, and which mean that she will still need to diversify her range of products and services in the future.

loans.use: to renew her stock of rice, oil and milk and other products, which was stolen.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: bisutería, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos.

La señora Rosario,  indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Amigas” (Friends) communal bank has begun its 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II loan center. “Friends” is composed of 8 members and is led by a directorate headed by Rosario. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are varied, including selling costume jewelry, groceries, meals, cosmetics, and operating a neighborhood store.  

Rosario tells us that prior to the 3 years she has worked with Pro Mujer, she joined the communal bank at the invitation of her friends. Now she has a neighborhood general store that has been in existence for some time.

The loan that she seeks is for buying groceries in the local public markets, to be sold in her stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosario responded that she likes the savings.

loans.use: buy merchandise (groceries) for a general store.

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en: Selpha is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children,  4 years old and 8 years old. She describes herself to be clean and hard-working. She operates a greengrocery where she sells kale, eggs, onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located at a densely populated  area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and insecurity in the area. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more onions and kale to sell. Selpha's business goal is to expand her grocery store into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy more kale and onions for resale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a married man. He has three children whose ages range from five to twelve. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells home product such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, tea leaves etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of household items. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. Isaac's business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of household goods within five years.

loans.use: buy more household items to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is four years old. He describes himself to be honest and trustworthy. He operates a grocery store where he sells kale, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, etc. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located at a densely populated  area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery store. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more onions and kale to sell. Joseph's business goal is to expand his  grocery store into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy kale and onions.

loans.name: Rosa Libelia

texts.en: Rosa is a hard-working 57-year-old married woman who has been working with cattle for about 20 years. Her gift with animals was discovered at a very early age, when, encouraged by her mother, she began taking care of a little cow. She now works alongside her husband and hopes that with this loan she will be able to increase the number of livestock under her care. Rosa's hope for the future is that her family remains healthy and happy and that the number of her cattle continue to increase.

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.en: Maria is thirty-seven, married, and has three daughters. She owns a small restaurant in Ibarra, Ecuador which serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily.  She started her business seven years ago, cooking baked chicken at home and delivering it to her customers. Because Maria's chicken recipe is unique and delicious, it didn't take long for her business to grow and soon, with the help of another small loan, she was able to move it to a small locale. Maria is now hoping, with her third loan, to purchase a few more things, such as an automatic dishwasher, to improve her restaurant even more. She also hopes to add more variety to her now-fixed menu. In time, it is Maria's dream to open another branch of the restaurant in a more central location, and with the income from it, to save enough money to send her three daughters to college.

loans.use: To make improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: M'kubitu

texts.en:
M'kubitu is a married old man. He has six children whose ages range from twenty-five to thirty-six. He describes himself as an ambitious and honest man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, tea leaves etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive business location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. M'kubitu's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a Kiva borrower. She has no children yet. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, tea leaves etc. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in a conducive business location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. 

Judy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale and plastic items. Judy's business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy household items and plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is a 43-year-old farmer from the village of Ruisi, East Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. Kamo’s parents are retired and Kamo is the only income provider in the family. They have a milk cow and Kamo produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also the family owns 2 hectares of land. Kamo grows tomatoes, cabbage, barley, maize and onions. He sells harvested products to greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris, including the pensions of Kamo’s parents. 

Kamo requested credit for renting a tractor  to till the land. Also, with the borrowed amount Kamo will purchase fertilizers. After proper cultivation and fertilizing, Kamo can count on good harvest in summer, which will be sold for an appropriate price. Kamo will use 30% of the borrowed funds for start-up of a new business. He will purchase piglets to set up a pig farm, which will be an additional source of the income for the family. With the increased income Kamo will be able to improve living conditions for himself and his aged parents.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase piglets

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара более четырех лет занимается скотоводством. Она замужем. Ей 33  года. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Gulsara has been involved in animal husbandry for over four years.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, tea leaves etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an ideal business location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. 

Samuel will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Samuel's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 54 years old and lives in the village of Pkhvenisi, East Georgia with her husband David. They earn a living by farming their two-hectare plot of land, where they grow tomatoes, cabbages, apples, cherries and pears. They sell the fruit and vegetables they harvest to local green groceries, and their total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Mariam has requested a loan to rent a tractor which will till the land, and to buy seeds and fertilizers. Mariam and David will work hard on their plot for the whole spring in order to get a good harvest in the summer. They hope that their harvest will be sold for a good price and the family will be able to earn enough money for the coming year.

loans.use: to pay for tilling services and to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two to nine. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are local residents that visit the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of cereals. 

Janet will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cereals for resale. Janet's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом житель района Джиликул. Он холост. Ему 23 года. Он имеет среднее образование. Абдусалом занимается выращиванием овощей. Он берет кредит для закупа семян картошки и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Abdusalom is a resident of the Jilikul district.  He is 23 years old and single.  He has a secondary education.  Abdusalom is involved in growing vegetables.  He is requesting this loan to purchase potato seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en: Maria Isabel is a forty-five-year-old married mother of two who describes herself as a very responsible person. She opened up her little neighborhood store three years ago and it has since been doing very well. Maria Isabel has decided to take out her first loan with which she hopes to increase the variety of products she offers in her store, and begin selling things such as soaps and shampoos. She is very excited about this next step and hopes that the larger supply of products will attract a wider variety of clients. Her dream is to make enough money to send her seventeen-year-old daughter to a good college and to continue to expand her business in order to stabilize her family's income level.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her convenience store.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz, a farmer from a small village in Kartli Region, East Georgia, is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his wife – Ia, his 10-year-old son and 10-month-old daughter. Malkhaz works as a construction laborer in the village. Along with his main job, he is also actively involved in the family agricultural business. The family has two milk cows. Ia produces traditional Georgian cheese. Also, Malkhaz and Ia grow wheat, onions, cabbage and tomatoes on the family-owned 3-hectare plot of land. Harvested vegetables and grains, as well as home-made cheese, are sold on the local open market to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Malkhaz requested credit for hiring a tractor to till the land. Also part of the credit will be used for purchasing vegetable seeds. Malkhaz will sow high quality species of the vegetables and work hard during the spring season, in order to get a good harvest in summer, which will be sold for an appropriate price. The family will use received income for financing their daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation service and purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Jamshed
