He sells their products at market.  In winter, he harvests sesame to obtain better income and to have better living conditions.

He came to Ceprodel with all of his friendliness to request a loan to buy a calved cow and a developing calf.  These will be of much use to him and will be a great benefit for the production of more milk and therefore to increase his income so he and his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow and a calf.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Norma cuenta con 49 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos que solo uno esta estudiando se llama Arquímedes esta cursando 4° grado de primaria, Alejandro y ana ya no estudian solo terminaron la secundaria, su esposo se llama Bonifacio es campesino. Ella es comerciante vende productos del campo como son: Maíz, Fríjol, Calabaza, Jaimaca, dice que le va muy bien con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de el Maíz, Fríjol ella esta muy contenta con el negocio ya tiene 4 años con ese negocio y le esta funcionando.

Norma pertenece al grupo las maravillas el cual esta integrado Maria Elena, Daniela, Maria Guadalupe, Carmela, Nicolasa, Marcela, Llanet, Amanda, Marciana, Zeferina, Norma, Filiberto, Armanda, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de frijol, maiz, pescados, verduras, mercería, venta de pollos menudeados, etc.
texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. Only one of her children, Arquímedes, is studying in the 4th grade in elementary. Alejandro and Ana no longer study and they made it all the was to junior high school. Her husband is named Bonifacio and is a farmer. She sells produce such as corn, beans, squash, and jamaica. She says her business is going very well and will use the loan to buy corn, and beans. She is very happy with her business and has been in it for 4 years.

Norma belongs to the group The Marvels which is composed of Maria Elena, Daniela, Maria Guadalupe, Carmela, Nicolasa, Marcela, Llanet, Amanda, Marciana, Zeferina, Norma, Filiberto, and Armanda. They each work in their own businesses such as bean, corn, fish, vegetable, sewing merchandise, and chicken merchants, etc.

loans.use: buy corn, beans, squash, jamaica, etc.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar est un homme de 39 ans qui vit dans une des localités sénégalaises. Il s’adonne à la vente de pièces détachées pour véhicules. Il a choisi son activité dans le souci d’obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins personnels. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour honorer ses engagements vis  à  vis de ses fournisseurs. Ce financement  pourra l’aider à maintenir la stabilité de son activité de commerce, a s’assurer un niveau de vie meilleur  et une prise en charge de ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Mr. Babacar is a 39-year-old man who lives in a Senegalese town. He devotes himself entirely to selling spare parts for vehicles. He chose this business to earn the revenues enabling him to support himself. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for honoring his commitments to his suppliers. This financing will be able to help him maintain a stable business and ensure a better standard of living, as well as meet his everyday expenses.

loans.use: to honor a commitment regarding his supplier of spare parts

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de quien es responsable, viven en un caserío rural llamado “Tierras Duras” a unos 10 minutos aproximadamente del distrito de La Matanza En la Provincia de Morropón del departamento de Piura. El caserío donde vive es pequeño y la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican la agricultura.

Augusto cuenta con un vehiculo menor (mototaxy) en el cual da servicio de transporte de caserío en caserío siendo su activad principal, y adicionalmente recorre algunos caseríos por las mañanas vendiendo artículos de primera necesidad en su vehiculo. A estas dos actividades se viene dedicando un aproximado de 3 años, con los cuales ha ido generando sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.

El desea aprovechar la campaña escolar que se aproxima para vender útiles escolares con los que pueda generarse mayores utilidades, para mejorar su calidad de vida, y a la vez cambiar llantas a su vehiculo, por el motivo que esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme alternativa por un monto de 2010 Nuevos Soles para cumplir con sus objetivos.

El trabajo lo realiza con responsabilidad y mucha dedicación por lo que se ha ganado el cariño de los habitantes de su caserío.
texts.en:
Augusto is 30 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children, for whom he is responsible. They live in a small rural town called "Tierras Duras" approximately 10 minutes away from the district of "La Matanza" in the providence of Morropón in the administrative district of Piura. The town where he lives is small and a majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture.

Augusto counts on his motorcycle taxi which he uses to provide transportation services from town to town, which is his principle activity.  He also travels around some small towns in the mornings selling basic necessities from his vehicle.  He has been dedicated to these two jobs for approximately 3 years, and they have helped him generate income to maintain his family.

He hopes to take advantage of the new school year by selling school supplies which can generate higher profits.  This would improve his quality of life and he would be able to change the tires on his vehicle. This is his motivation to ask for a line of credit from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2010 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency), as it will help him accomplish his objectives.

He does his work responsibly and with great dedication, which is what has enabled him to win the friendship of the inhabitants of his small town.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.es:
La señorita Martha Olivia tiene su  negocio en el municipio del Sauce, el cual consiste en la venta de comida, donde cuenta con un comedor propio, ofreciendo exquisitos   tipos  de comida al gusto de sus clientes que la visitan  desde las comarcas y del municipio, cuenta con un nieto a  su cargo. 

Se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de Arroz, Aceite, Azúcar y verdura, para la preparación de los platillos que oferta y así lograr  satisfacer la demanda,  está consciente que nuestra institución apoya este tipo de actividad comercial ya que  ella cuenta con su propio negocio, donde esto le ha permitido obtener mejores ingresos para el desarrollo  familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Olivia has a business in the town of Sauce where she sells food from a canteen. She offers a delicious variety of dishes that satisfy customers who come from different areas of the town. She has a nephew that helps out.

She showed up at the Ceprodel office to request a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, and vegetables to prepare the dishes she sells and satisfy her client's demand. She is aware that this institution supports these types of businesses and she counts on her business to make more profits to maintain her family.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes in larger quantities.

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es:
El socio Yedi pertenece al Banco Comunal “IMASUMAC II y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

El socio Yedi sigue dedicándose prestando servicio de transporte urbano de taxi y el socio Yedi cobra 2.50 la carrera y cuando es un poco lejos cobra 3 nuevos soles, el socio desea en esta ocasión invertir el préstamo en el mantenimiento de su taxi ya que le ha estado fallando el freno. 

El socio Yedi agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Yedi belongs to the communal bank "IMASUMAC II" and lives in the city of Cusco, where he also works.  Yedi continues offering a taxi service.  He charges 2.5 PEN for a trip, and when it is a little farther, he charges 3 PEN.  He hopes to invest this loan in the maintenance of his taxi because its breaks are failing.  Yedi is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle in order to continue growing financially and to continue supporting his wife and children.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr: Monsieur Djibril  vit au Sénégal. Il gère une boutique dans le quartier de sa zone d’habitation. Il a choisi son activité par nécessité dans le but d’augmenter  ses revenus. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de  produits alimentaires qu’il va commercialiser dans sa boutique. Son intention est d’augmenter le stock de produits de sa boutique. Ce financement pourra l’aider à accroitre ses gains  afin de pouvoir soutenir ou  prendre en charge  les  membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djibril lives in Senegal. He runs a shop in his local neighborhood.

He chose this line of work by necessity, with the goal of increasing his revenue. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 frs to buy foodstuffs that he will sell in his shop. His intention is to increase the supply of products in his shop.

This loan will help him to increase his profits so that he can support or care for his family members.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs intended for resale

loans.name: Johaihupape Ñamba´apo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “JOHAIHUPAPE ÑAMBA´APO” es un comité de 17 mujeres que están muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, donde todas son vecinas y amigas.
Una de las miembros es Maria, ella es artesana, y comenta que trabaja en esto desde hace mucho tiempo. Aprendió este oficio y desde esa vez se ha dedicado a esto. Por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darles lo que necesitan para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas, además de telas para seguir tejiendo sus artesanías. Su propósito es seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: The group, “JOHAIHUPAPE ÑAMBA´APO” is made up of 17 women who are very well-organized, united, hard-working, and supportive of one another.  These women are from the city of Villarrica, where they are all friends and neighbors.  One of the members is Maria.  She is a craftswoman, and she tells us that she has done this work for a long time.  She learned her trade and since then, she has been dedicated to it.  Through her work, she has been able to help her family and give them what they need to have a better lifestyle.  She is requesting this loan to buy thread, needles, and fabric to continue weaving her traditional craftwok.  Her goal is to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and needles.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Leonita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her pigs. Leonita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Monceda

texts.en:
Monceda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Monceda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Monceda would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 53 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Angelina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente , leader du groupe d’affaire «Ushuhuda », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 50  ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat. Elle est  vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Il y a  12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  10eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  de produits divers ( pommes de terre, huile, farine, Fanta, haricots, etc.)  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The leader of the "Ushuhuda" group, is an entrepreneur. She is 50 years old, married, and mother of five young children, who are all in school. Her husband is a civil servant. She is a vendor of foodstuffs.

She has been performing little, income-generating activities like this for the past 12 years. She just received her 10th loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up on various products (potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, beans, etc.). She also hopes to see her children grow up comfortably, and to grow her business. 

She would like to thank Hekima for helping poor women who do not have access to classic banking.

loans.use: to buy various products (potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business direct-selling Avon products for two years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store and from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and spare parts for his vulcanizing business. Edgar has been in this business for seven years. He earns additional income from buying and selling of scrap and his sari-sari (variety) store.

Edgar has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. He dreams of saving enough money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: El Arbol De Neen Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  El Árbol de Neen sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que en su comunidad se  va mucho ese árbol de neen  que sirve para controlar le diabetes y la presión.
Este grupo esta conformado por  tres  personas trabajadoras amables y con deseos  que cumplir y mejorar sus vidas.
El representante de este grupo es el señor  Francisco  Bruno un señor trabajador e inteligente  tiene  cuarenta y dos  años de edad esta felizmente casado con la señora Maura Berta una señora trabajadora amable  con las fuerzas necesarias para ayudar a su esposo en lo que necesite.
Tienen tres hijos  Berta  Sofía, Eva Maria  y Carla Idolina  son sus orgullos y en motivo por cual luchan para seguirles ayudando para que puedan alcanzar sus sueños y darles una buena educación.
Don Chico como mejor lo conocen  se dedica a la Producción de  de Limón y plátano desde hace cinco años.
El poscuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es  ir a fertilizar 
 sus plantas y ver como crecen.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de  fertilizantes para  sus plantas para que den unos limones grandes y jugosos y unos plátanos grandes y dulces.
El nos comenta que esta agradecido con fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado par que su negocio crezca  y pueda  trabajar bien sus tierras.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Ana Maria-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Perla  Fabiola- quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos y hacer que sus vidas cambien a base de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is called El Árbol de Neen (the Tree of Neen). Its members decided to call it that because in their community, there are a lot of Neen trees, which serve to control diabetes and blood pressure.  This group is made up of three hardworking and nice people with desires to improve and complete their lives. The representative of this group is Mr. Francisco Bruno, an intelligent and hard-working man of 42 years who is happily married to Mrs. Maura Berta, a very nice and hard-working woman with the strength necessary to help her husband with what he needs. They have three children, Berta Sofía, Eva Maria and Carla Idolina. They are their pride and motivation to fight to continue helping them so the children can achieve their dreams and the parents can give the kids a good education. Better known as Don Chico, Mr. Bruno has been dedicated to the production of limes and bananas since he was five years old. He tells us that what he most enjoys in his business is going out to fertilize his plants and watching them grow.  He asked for the loan in order to buy fertilizer for his plants in order to keep the limes large and juicy and the bananas big and sweet. He tells us that he is grateful to the Kiva field partner for the help that it has given him to support business growth and so that he can work his land well.

The other members of the group are: 
Ana Maria- who is dedicated to the sale of clothes.
Perla Fabiola- who is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables.

They give thanks to the Kiva partner foundation for helping them and changing their lives based on effort and work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for lime trees and for banana bushes

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se formó con la union de vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Carapeguá, quienes vieron en el programa de la fundacion paraguaya una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias. Su objetivo principal es poder ayudar a sus familias y de esa forma mejorar sus estilos de vida.
Una historia digna de rescatar es el de la sra. Damasia Fque es una señora muy humilde de la zona que se dedica a tejer sus hamacas y frazadas, tiene 2 hijos, su marido es albañil  pero a veces faltan recursos para mantener la casa y a los hijos. Ella se emocionó bastante cuando le hicieron el ofrecimiento porque nunca le habían dado esta oportunidad de crédito ya que le ha sido de demasiada ayuda.
Esta vez acude a la fundación nuevamente para solicitar un préstamo, que desea invertir en la compra de hilos, agujas y demás insumos con cuales podrá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
San Cayetano was founded by a group of neighbors and friends in the city of Carapeguá. They saw that Fundación Paraguaya's program could be a big help for them and their families. Their main objective is to be able to help their families, and in this way improve their way of life. 

A story worth telling is that of Damasia, a very modest woman from the area who weaves hammocks and blankets. She has two children and her husband is a bricklayer, but sometimes they don't have enough to support their house and children. Demasia was very moved when they made her the offer, because she'd never been given this opportunity for credit, and since they've already been of so much help. 

This time the group is turning to the foundation again to ask for a loan, which they want to invest in the purchase of yarn, needles, and other goods with which they will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy yarn, needles, and other goods.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: María es un mujer de 50 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa su historia empezó para ayudar en los gastos del hogar, su trabajo lo hace sola, si tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, si está casada su esposo es taxista, si tiene 2 hijas ellas estudian en una escuela fiscal, su sueño más importante es tener un local propio en mi casa para la venta. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas  etc.
texts.en: María is 50 years old and has many aspirations for the following years to expand her clothing sales. She started out selling clothes in order to help out with household expenditures. She works alone and one of her obstacles includes crime. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. She has 2 daughters who study in a public school. Her biggest dream is to have her own locale located in her home to sell her clothes. She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, etc.

loans.use: buy clothes such as pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en: Jeanna is 43 years old and married with four children. She is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Jeanna has owned and operated a fishing business for six years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month. Jeanna joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is from the Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old and married. To make a living, Ellen owns and operates a pedicab transport service. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Ellen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her pedicab. In 2011, Ellen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her pedicab.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and has three children. She is 60 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years and each month she earns PHP 3,000. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elizabeth wants to build a house and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has seven children.

Teresita has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married and has three children. He is 38 years old and lives in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Richard is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 11 years and every month he earns PHP 7,000. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

In 2011, Richard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Richard hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Abel has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands (a traditional Filipino dish) such as afritada and caldereta. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Abel has been a member of HSPFI for since 2008.  In the future, Abel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Algie

texts.en:
Algie is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has two children.

Algie provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

Algie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Peter is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

Peter is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Peter hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Princess Mae

texts.en:
Princess Mae is 20 years old and single.

Princess Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Princess Mae has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready to wear business for three years.

Princess Mae aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Flor Clara

texts.es:
Flor Clara tiene 57 años es casada tiene 6 hijos pero todos son casados y viven fuera de Cimbo, vive con el esposo y una nieta. Vive en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Esta Ventanilla se llama SINABAMBA, se encuentra ubicada en La parroquia La Magdalena que perteneciente al Canton Chimbo a 15 minutos de la Oficina Matriz, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas como a la siembra de maiz.

Flor Clara se dedida a la siembra de maiz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del credito lo va a invertir en la compra de  semillas, fungicidas para evitar las enfermedades. El credito lo a apoyado para seguir invirtiendo. el sueño de Flor es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando con la ayuda del esposo.

En los tiempos libres sale de paseo con la nieta.
texts.en:
Flor Clara is 57 years old, married, and has six children. All of them are married and live outside of Chimbo. Flor lives with her husband and a granddaughter in Chimbo in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank named “Sinabamba” is located in the parish of La Magdalena, which is part of the canton of Chimbo and 15 minutes away from the home office. The members engage in farm work, such as growing corn.

Flor Clara grows corn on her own land and partially on rented land. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fungicides for combatting diseases. This loan will help her continue investing. Flor’s dream is to have good health so that she can continue working with the help of her husband.

In her free time, Flor enjoys going for walks with her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fungicides.

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elenita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. 

To make a living, Elenita owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products in the local community. She has been in her business for four years and earns 7,000 PHP per month. In 2008, Elenita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rolem

texts.en: Rolem is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Kuña Renda 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Renda es un grupo integrado por 15 señoras que decidieron formar un comité solidario, cada una con un sentimiento de superación están actualmente en el 4to. Son muy trabajadoras, unidas y responsables.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, quien nos comenta que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante e ir progresando en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo y cuenta que había empezado con un pequeño negocio, opero que hoy en día ya ha podido ir creciendo. Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea invertir en la compra de bebidas, para poder abastecer su negocio.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad de progreso que ellas y sus amigas estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
"Kuña Renda" is a group that consists of 15 women who decided to form a solidarity committee. Each member has the desire to succeed and they are currently in their fourth loan cycle. They are hardworking, unified, and responsible.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. She says that with great effort, she has been able to move forward and make progress in her business. Maria sells beverages of all types and indicates that she started out with a small business. To this day, she has been able to continue growing. She approached Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to request a loan. She wants to invest in the purchase of beverages to restock her business. She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress which she and her friends have received.

loans.use: to buy beverages for eventual resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia Leonor nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de  esta unión tiene tres hijos. Leonor es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como pollos.  En esta oportunidad Leonor requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos.  
  
La socia Leonor agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Leonor was born in the city of Cusco and is 44 years of age. She is married and has three children. Leonor is an enterprising and hardworking woman who helps move her family forward. Her business involves raising small animals, such as chickens. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more chickens.

Leonor is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “FE EN DIOS”, actualmente se encuentra en el VIII ciclo, las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa, el banco comunal está conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios  son por ejemplo;  venta de cosméticos, venta de casacas, venta de zapatos, alquiler de andamios,  venta de ropa  y otros ofrecen servicios de seguridad y contabilidad. El banco comunal tiene varios años de funcionamiento, como manifiestan los socios. Los socios se encuentran contentos y satisfechos con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Yomira forma parte del banco comunal “Fe en Dios”, ella tiene 35 años de edad, ella nació en la ciudad de Puno, ella tiene dos hijos y se llaman Luís Marcelo y Bryham de la cuales los dos dependen todavía de ella, ella nos cuenta que es madre y padre para sus hijos pues no recibe apoyo de su pareja. Yomira alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus actividades comerciales como por ejemplo venta de casacas, venta de ropa y venta de zapatos. Ella nos cuenta que las casacas que venden son exportadas del país de Argentina y los ofrece a las instituciones públicas y los zapatos los trae de la ciudad de Puno y los ofrece a las vendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Yomira nos cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito pero en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería exclusiva para damas. 

Ya son varios años que trabaja con los bancos solidarios y con la Asociación Arariwa y le ha ido muy bien gracias a la responsabilidad que le caracteriza.
texts.en:
The community bank “Fe en Dios" or "Faith in God,” is currently in its eighth loan cycle, and the partner meetings are every month in the central office of the Arariwa Association.  The community bank is composed of 11 hard-working and ambitious people who look for opportunity at every moment in order to move forward and through daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. It is a community bank comprised of members that live in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic center, its scenery, its history, and for being a charming city in the Southern Region of the country.

Some of the economic activities of the members include: selling cosmetics, jackets, and shoes, renting scaffolds, and selling clothes, while others offer security and accounting services. The community bank has been functioning for several years, as the members can attest.  The members are happy and satisfied with the credit services, savings and trainings.  Due to the amount of time they have been with the communal bank, members are able to earn valuable compound interest on their savings.  

Yorma forms part of the community bank “Faith in God.” She is 35 years old and was born in the city of Puno. She has two children named Luís Marcelo and Bryham. The two still depend on her, and she is both the mother and father of her children since she doesn’t receive support from her partner. Yomira alternates her home activities with commercial activities like selling coats, clothes and shoes. She tells us that the jackets that they sell are exported from the country of Argentina and they offer them to public institutions. The shoes are brought from the city of Puno and are offered to the sellers in various markets in Cusco. Yomira tells us that things went very well with the previous loan but this time she needs the loan to buy more merchandise exclusively for women.

She has now been working withe the communal banks for several years and also with the Asociación Arariwa, and it has gone very well thanks to the responsibility that characterizes her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise exclusively for women.

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 37 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Djiguène Bakhna 37 regroupe 5 femmes qui font toute du commerce de fruits. Elles se sont regroupées parce qu’habitant le même quartier. La présidente, madame Ndiémé, exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits : orange, mandarine et divers autre fruits selon la période. Elle démarre sa journée à 7 h et l’a fini à 20 h. Ses efforts ne sont pas veine car elle réussi à épargner de l’argent, mais aussi à aider dans la dépense quotidienne de la maison. Elle a comme projet futur de trouver une cantine sur la route nationale pour pouvoir plus mettre en valeur ses marchandises et acquérir une clientèle plus diversifiée et plus nombreuse.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 37 group is made up of 5 women who all sell fruit. They all live in the same neighborhood. The group's president, Madame Ndiémé, has been a fruit seller for ten years. She is married and has a family. Her activity involves selling fruit: oranges, mandarins and other fruit, depending on the season. Her day starts at 7 am and ends at 8 pm. Her efforts are not in vain; she is able to save money, and also help with daily household expenses. 

In the future, she plans to set up a kiosk on the main road to increase the visibility of her merchandise, and to gain a larger and more diversified clientele.

loans.use: to buy fruit, such as oranges and mandarins, for resale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and married with four children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: San Fernando Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal San Fernando II, está conformado por 10 emprendedores que han trabajado con Fundación León 2000, en el cual durante el ciclo que han venido trabajando con el crédito han demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, han demostrado ser unas personas responsable y con un record crediticio intachable. Santos Isabel es parte todavía de este grupo y nos expresa que gracias al apoyo con el crédito ha aumentado su productos y que sus clientes están contentos por la variedad que les ofrece, ella con este crédito nuevo comprara leche, cuajada, queso crema entre otros productos para la elaboración de cuajada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “San Fernando II” consists of 10 entrepreneurs who have worked with Fundación León 2000. During the cycle in which they have worked with loans, the members have demonstrated that they are responsible people who desire to succeed. As a result, their credit record is impeccable.

Santos Isabel is still part of this group and expresses her thanks for the support. With the loans, she has been able to increase her products and her customers are pleased with the variety that she offers. Santos will use her new loan to buy milk, curds, cheese, cream, and products used for making curds.

loans.use: to buy milk, curds, cheese, cream, and other products.

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.ru: Хазраткул житель района Рудаки. Он женат. Ему 33 года. У него один ребенок. Он предоставляет услугу. Хазраткул занимается развозкой пассажиров на своей машине марки «Starex». В этой области он четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Hazratdul is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is married, 33 years old and has one child. He provides a service. Hazratkul transports passengers on his car by make of Starex. He has been in this business for four years. He is taking out the loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair the car.

loans.name: Abdusodik

texts.ru: Абдуксодик мужчина 41 года, женат, имеет семерых детей. Работает в колхозе поливщиком полей. Его зарплата очень маленькая и не хватает на проживание, поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него четыре коровы, которые дают молоко. Его жена продаёт молоко в кишлаке своим соседям. На полученный кредит Абдусодик хочет купить корм для коров и ещё пару молодых телят, которые откормив в сезон продаст за хорошую цену.
texts.en: Abdusodik is a 41 year old man, married and has seven children. He works in the collective farm as a field irrigation worker. His salary is very small and is not enough to live on and this is why he feeds and resells cattle. Right now he has four cows which give milk. His wife sells the milk in the kishlak (village) to the neighbors. Abdusodik wants to use the received loan to buy fodder for the cows and also a couple of young calves which he will resell for a good price during the season after feeding them.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder for them.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory se denomina el grupo de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el 12º ciclo con 15 integrantes. Son señoras que se esfuerzan para salir adelante y solventar los gastos diarios del hogar. La intención de las señoras fue formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con el beneficio del crédito otorgado con el fin de lograr mejorar su emprendimiento y calidad de vida.
La Sra. Gloria es una de las integrantes que se esmera muchísimo para poder dar a su familia un mejor futuro. Ella es comerciante, tiene una despensa en su casa e invierte su sus ganancias en su negocio. Ella está muy contenta por formar parte del  programa de Comités de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  dice que  su actividad es muy provechosa ya que nota el progreso gracias al beneficio y oportunidad de la acceder a los créditos mediante la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Carapeguá is called "Kuña Rory." It is now in its 12th loan cycle and has 15 members. They are women who strive to advance and pay for their daily household expenses. The goal of the women was to become part of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women to have the benefit of the loans offered, with the goal of improving their business ventures and their quality of life.

Señora Gloria is one of the members who does her very best to be able to give her family a better future. She is a retailer. She has a convenience store in her home and invests her earnings in her business. She is very happy to be part of the Committees of Entrepreneurial Women program. She says that her business is very profitable since she notices the progress thanks to the benefit and opportunity to access loans through the Fundación Paraguaya.

She is applying for the loan to be able to buy foods, beverages, and other items, with which she will stock her business.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Damas Unidas"se originó a traves de promociones  que se isó en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Alejandra, es Presidenta del grupo, ejerce la profesión de peluquera en su humilde hogar, en lo cual le va muy bien. Gracias a su negocio ha podido crecer y ser una buena comerciante.  Su deseo es habilitar una heladería a lado de su peluquería a fin de incrementar su ingreso, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera adquirir el múltiple beneficio que la Fundación le pueda ofrecer. Ella pondra el mayor de su esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cremas, tintes, esmaltes, shampoo y demás insumos para poder surtir su peluquería.
texts.en:
The community bank "Damas Unidas" [United Women] started with promotions in the neighborhood. All the members are from the same area, acquaintances and neighbors in the neighborhood. The goal of each and every woman is to work, to promote their collective spirit, and to arrive at the maximum level of the program. 

Alejandra, the group's president, is a hair dresser and works in her modest home, which is going very well. Thanks to her business she has been able to grow and become a good shopkeeper. Her dream is to finance an ice cream parlor next to her beauty salon, with the goal of increasing her income. 

Alejandra declares that she's very at ease with her community bank and hopes to reap the many benefits offered by Fundación Paraguaya. She will put the majority of her energy to ensure that the group develops and gets ahead. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy creams, dyes, nail polish, shampoo and other goods to stock her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy goods to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en: This is 43 year old Ivy from Harare. She is married with two children, one attending school.  Ivy runs a manufacturing business producing drinks. The business has been in operation for 22 years. She says the main challenge faced is stiff competition. Ivy has requested a loan of $400 to buy raw materials to manufacture drinks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Ivy plans to supply big retail outlets.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture drinks

loans.name: Leoniteria

texts.en: Leoniteria is 60 years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Leoniteria's main source of income comes from selling soap, canned goods, and boost food in her community. Leoniteria has been in this business for 8 years and earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Leoniteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoniteria is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Association Des Relais Et Agents De Santé Communautaires (Arc) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ARC est constitué de 2 agents de santé communautaires et de 3 relais polyvalents. Les agents de santé sont des bénévoles qui aident l'Infirmier chef de poste du village alors que les relais sont des volontaires qui interviennent dans la sensibilisation des populations sur certaines maladies.Ils se sont organisés pour mener des activités économiques pour se prendre en charge ainsi que leurs familles respectives.Ils font ainsi de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Le chef de groupe, en blanc, est un homme marié.Il est père de 5 enfants dont les 3 vont à l'école.Il mène des séances de sensibilisation auprès des populations pour venir à bout du paludisme et des diarrhées  qui sont les principales maladies qui sévissent dans le village. Aujourd'hui, le groupe sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter 20 moutons. L'ambition du groupe est de toujours agrandir leur activité.
texts.en:
Group ARC is constituted of two community healthcare agents and three polyvalent mediators. Healthcare agents are volunteers who assist the village head nurse, while mediators are volunteers who contribute to raising the population’s awareness about certain diseases.
They set up paying occupations for themselves, which allows them to support themselves and their respective families. They notably fatten beef and sheep. The group’s leader, wearing white, is a married man. He is a father of five; three of his children attend school. He leads awareness-raising sessions for the local population, in order to defeat malaria and diarrhea, the main diseases afflicting the village.
Today, the group is soliciting a loan for 500,000 FCFA with which they will purchase 20 sheep. The group’s ambition is to always develop their activity.

loans.use: buy twenty sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy "boubous" (Senegalese kaftans) for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa, con apoyo de la fundación paraguaya.
La sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza, y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la repostería y vende por la zonas alrededores. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos del día a día de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de belleza, como ser labiales, polvos, maquillajes, bases y demás tipos, con los cuales podrá surtirse y cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esparanza" (New Hope) communal bank began in the city of San Ignacio. It is made up of 14 women, all friends and neighbors in this city. The goal of each one of them is to work, develop a united spirit, and arrive at the highest level of the program, with the support of Fundación Paraguaya.

Señora Petrona is the president of the group. She sells beauty products, and in her free time she works at the confectionery and sells throughout the neighboring zones. Her desire is to continue working and in this way be able to continue helping her family with the day to day expenses.

She is applying for the loan to purchase beauty products such as lipstick, powders, makeup, bases, and other types, with which she will be able to stock up and fill the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en: This is 52-year-old Veronica from Harare. She is widowed with four children.Veronica runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capacity to satisfy the market. Veronica has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes from South Africa. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Veronica plans to open a big shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Blessmore

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 22 year old Blessmore from Harare. She is married with one child.  Blessmore runs a health business selling surgical materials. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Blessmore has requested a loan of $1 500 to buy surgical materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Blessmore plans to supply surgical equipments to most parts of Zimbabwe.

loans.use: to buy surgical materials for resale

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
Marlon José actualmente es conductor,  un joven  con valores, deseos  de superación,   padre de  cuatro  hijos a  su cargo, los cuales quiere darles un futuro mejor con un techo digno y seguro.

Por esta razón,  se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para  compra de Cementó, Arena Y ladrillo, debido a que ha estado un poquito afectado con los fenómenos que han transcurrido en la zona, esto le permitirá obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Currently Marlon José is a driver.  He is a young man with values who wants to improve himself, and the father of four children in his care whom he wants to give a better future with a decent and safe roof over their heads.

For this reason he went to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, because he has been a little affected by things that have happened in this region.  This will allow him to have better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children. Gena owns and operates a business running a "balot"*** food stall in the local community. Gena has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

***fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Waax  Baax Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "WAAX  BAAX " se compose de 5 femmes toutes mariées.Elles se sont constituées en groupe de solidarité et mène l'activité d'embouche bovine.Elles achètent des moutons qu'elle engraissent pendant  7 mois pour les revendre et se partager les bénéfices.Les revenus tirès de l'activité leur permettent ainsi de subvenir à leurs besoins et d'appui leurs maris dans la prise en charge de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe, en jaune au milieu est mère de 5 enfants. Les 2 vont à l'école alors que les 3 autres pratiquent l'agriculture.
Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 25 moutons. Leur ambition est de s'engager plus tard dans l'embuche bovine.
texts.en:
Group "Waax Baax" is composed of 5 women, who are all married. They created their solidarity group and are in the business of ovine fattening. They purchase sheep, which they fatten for seven months, in order to resell them and share the profits. Profits from this business allow them to provide for themselves and to support their husbands in the care of their respective families.
The group leader, wearing yellow and in the middle, is a mother of five. Two of her children attend school, while three work in farming.
The group is requesting a loan of 500,000 FCFA with which to purchase 25 sheep. Their ambition is later to start in bovine fattening.

loans.use: purchase 25 sheep.

loans.name: Zair

texts.ru: Заир является потомственным пастухом, его отец и дед были пастухами в их селе в течении многих лет. Его семья - жена и дети, также помогают по уходу за козами и овцами. Его дети находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. У каждого из них есть свой дом и семьи. В прошлом году ему пришлось покупать корм по высокой цене. Ему приходилось доплачивать пастуху дополнительно, что бы искать корм  с водой и скот отводить в более дальние регионы. Учитывая повышения цены к весне, он решил получить кредит на скот, планирует приобрести несколько голов коз. Муминджон очень рад, что существуют организации такие как Арванд, которые могут помочь ему в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Zair is a hereditary shepherd. His father and grandfather were both shepherds in their village for many years. His family – wife and children also help him to take care of the goats and sheep. His children are now in the Russian Federation as workers. Every one of them has their own home and family.

In the past year Zair had to buy fodder at a higher price. He had to pay extra to the shepherd as well to go out and find fodder and water as well as take the cattle out to farther regions. Considering the higher prices in the spring he decided to get a loan for the cattle and plans to buy several goats. Zair is very happy that there are such organizations as Arvand which can help him during the hard times.

loans.use: to purchase several goats.

loans.name: Flor De Quinua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE QUINUA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pascuala. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de calzados, tejido de chompas, venta de tostado, lavado de autos, artesanía en estuco, venta de tejidos, tejido de mantas.

La señora Pascuala,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en yeso (estuco) que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, el mismo que aprendió de su yerno.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de compra de estuco) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es separada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Quinua” (Quinoa Flower) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pascuala. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling shoes, knitting sweaters, selling toasted foods, washing cars, making crafts from plaster, selling woven articles, and knitting blankets.

Sra. Pascuala says that she started working Pro Mujer one year ago and joined the organization upon receiving an invitation from a member. She currently has a business producing crafts out of plaster (stucco) where she has worked for some time. Pascuala learned this trade from her son-in-law.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing stucco that she acquires from the distribution shops. She will later sell the products she makes in her community. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Pascuala is separated from her spouse and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pascuala said that she enjoys sharing with her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy stucco for making crafts.

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.en:
Rosinda is 60 years old and married with nine children.

Rosinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosinda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosinda aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman who has four children. She is 47 years old, and resides at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Luzminda owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn her living. She has had 6 years experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP6,000.00 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to repair the borrower's fishing boat. This year, Luzminda joined GDMPC. In the future, Luzminda wants to build a house and to complete her children's studies.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is 54 years old and married. He has 4 children. He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Felimon is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for his pigs.

Felimon has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bread, operating a sari-sari store and also providing motorcycle transport. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, to save money and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Nissel has a shop where she sells clothing like blouses, shirts & underwear. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 to buy stock of clothing to sell.

Nissel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nissel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Gloria is married and has two children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gloria has been in her business for four years and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teojerma

texts.en:
Teojerma, together with her husband, is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials for her broom-making business.

Teojerma has been in this business for five years. Teojerma earns more income from making handicrafts, from a piggery and from a sari-sari (general) store.

Teojerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Doña Maria continua comercializando ropa, cosmeticos, y encargos que su clientela le hace, es atraves de sus ventas, pues es su medio de ganarse la vida, el cual lleva ya varios años,  con el financiamiento ha  venido a aumentar su mercaderia, lo que se ha favorecido con las ganancias para cumplir con sus compromiso de pago.
Con este nuevo prestamo, podra invertir en ropa de dama, ropa interior, cosmeticos, logrando mantener el equilibrio de sus ventas, asi mismo invertira un poco en la elaboracion de comida rapida, en tacos, enchiladas, hogdog, para vender los fines de semana en el cuadro de beisboll que se ha abierto la liga, y las ventas son buenas. Lo que se ayudara mas en su economia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria continues to sell clothing and cosmetics. She handles the orders received from her customers since this is how she makes her sales and earns her living. Maria has been in business for several years. With this loan, she will be able to increase her inventory of popular merchandise. Her earnings will allow her to complete her payment obligations.

Maria will use this new loan to invest in women’s clothing, undergarments, and cosmetics so that she can maintain stable sales. In addition, she will invest a small amount for preparing fast food such as tacos, enchiladas, and hot dogs to sell on the weekends at the baseball fields since the league season has started. Her sales should be good, which will be a great help to her finances.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics and to invest in fast food.

loans.name: Jessiry

texts.en:
Jessiry is 47 years old and married. She has 3 children. Jessiry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Jessiry has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF, prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jessiry aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mbada Group

texts.en:
This is 28 year old Rutendo from Harare. She is married and has two children, both attending school. Rutendo runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are too much competition, weather changes and an unstable economic environment. 

Rutendo has requested a loan of $400 to buy a variety of clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated, as a result of this loan, will allow her to assist in the upkeep of her family. In the future, Rutendo plans to own a bigger and much better clothing shop in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monicah, 37 years old, is from Nakuru and is single. She has a daughter who is 12 years old.

Monicah has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 18 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy sugar and washing detergents to add to her stock for sale.

In the future, Monicah hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and washing detergent.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Jennelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Jennelyn buys and sells eggs in the local community. Jennelyn has been in this business for three years and gets 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2010, Jennelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional eggs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik is 49 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She is married and has two children: a daughter and a son. Varsik’s daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents; Varsik's son has just finished serving in the Armenian army. 

Varsik, her husband and their son are engaged in animal breeding and potato growing as well. Together, they rear cows, sheep and pigs. They sell produced dairy products and meat and thus support their family. 

Varsik intends to develop her farm. Therefore, she wants to buy bull-calves for her farm. She is seeking a $ 2.500 loan to buy some bull-calves and fodder as well.  

This is Varsik’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy some bull-calves and fodder as well.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Arlyn has a shop where she sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old and married. She has 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 12,000, through NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Amancia works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Amancia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Amancia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman who has 2 children. Jocelyn is 49 years old, residing at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture, raising fish for sale to earn a living. She's had 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP8,000.00 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000.00 to purchase additional fish to raise. In 2011, Jocelyn became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 40 years old and married. She has 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Flor is borrowing PHP 10,000, through NWTF, to buy feed and additional piglets.

Ma. Flor has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is 60 years old and married. She has 2 children. Gwena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Gwena has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

Gwena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en: Erlina is married and has 4 children. She is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Erlina is a farmer and she operates a gardening venture to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Every month she earn 4,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This year, Erlina been a member of GDMPC. In the future, Erlina  hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Marina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Marina Enriqueta es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de primaria en una escuela de una comarca muy cercana a dicho municipio donde tiene mucha experiencia en la docencia y de enseñarles a leer y escribir a niños siendo este trabajo lo que la apasiona y permite que lleve el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Es madre soltera con una hija que ha sacado adelante sola con el esfuerzo propio y que ha educado de la mejor manera posible y como madre responsable quiere darle la mejor preparación profesionalmente para que sea una persona de bien, trabajadora y que se defienda en el futuro. 

Por tal razón, el crédito que ahora está solicitando es para la compra de pintura y una puerta para seguir mejorando su vivienda, ya que como parte de brindarle este bienestar a su querida hija está en tener un hogar con todas las condiciones adecuadas y que ceprodel siempre le ha brindado su apoyo desde que trabaja con créditos.
Por lo que espera con seguridad siempre el apoyo que ha recibido en créditos anteriores y no quedarles mal en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marina Enriqueta is originally from the town of El Sauce. She currently works as an elementary school teacher at a regional school near her town. Marina has plenty of experience teaching children how to read and write. She is passionate about her work, which has allowed her to earn a daily living.

Marina is a single mother with a daughter. She has pressed forward through her own efforts and provided her child with an education in the best way possible. Like any responsible mother, she wants to give her child the best preparation for becoming a professional and a person who is successful, hardworking, and able to provide for the future.

For this reason, Marina is requesting a loan now in order to buy paint and a door so that she can continue improving her home. Part of providing for her daughter involves having a home with adequate conditions. Ever since Marina started working with loans, CEPRODEL has always been supportive of her. With confidence, she always expects to have this support just as she did with her previous loans so that nothing will go wrong in the future.

loans.use: to buy paint and a door.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se esfuerzan por ayudarse.
La Sra. Sonia se dedica a la costura y cuenta que lleva mucho tiempo  en ese trabajo y eso la ha ayudado a formarse una buena clientela. Ella realiza todo tipo de prendas, de muy buena calidad, y es por ello que sus clientes siempre acuden hasta ella.
Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con los cuales podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members of this established committee have set forth as their main goal to be having each individual experience growth, not only financially, but on a personal level as well. These members are known in their area as extremely hardworking women who strive to help one another.

Sra. Sonia is a seamstress and has been in this line of work for a long time. This has helped her to establish a good customer base. She produces all types of garments that are of very good quality. For this reason, her customers always request her work. Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and thread so that she can complete her customers' orders. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is 60 years old and married with two children.

Cherlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods to sell in her store.

Cherlie has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 30 years and earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Cherlie aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en:
Abdulsalam is 28 years old, married and a father of only one son. He lives in Ibb, Yemen and his qualification is diploma only. 

Previously, he was a worker in a telecommunication shop, introducing phone services and selling mobile recharge cards to his customers. He has been involved in this kind of business since 2002.  After collecting enough money, he purchased this business from the owner and became in need of funds to purchase more goods for the shop to meet the demands of his clients. He would like to ask for financial assistance because his household expenses are continually increasing due to the needs of his growing son. He is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, he was encouraged to borrow additional capital.

Abdulsalam took a loan of 100,000 YER from Alamal Bank, which he will use to purchase mobile recharge cards to sell to his customer and to develop services for his telecommunications shop. 

In the future, he hopes to be a high merchant in order to buy a phone accessories store and to earn an increased income, which will enable him to pay his obligation in school and some of his household expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en: Phebe is a 29-year-old, single woman from Tabuan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Phebe's main source of income comes from selling a variety of home use products in her community. Phebe has been in her business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Phebe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Phebe is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Jesan Jan

texts.en:
Jesan Jan is 24 years old and married with a 7-month-old baby. He has been a seaweed farmer for a year now. Jesan Jan has his business in the island of Hingotanan, Bien Unido, Bohol. Jesan Jan also runs a sari-sari store business. He sells items like canned goods, detergent soap, snack foods and toiletries. Jesan Jan works hard to provide for his family.

Jesan Jan is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed farming materials such as seedlings, wooden pegs and strings. In the future, Jesan Jan hopes to expand his seaweed farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed farming materials

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 55 years old and married. She has five children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Nilda is engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She's been four years in this business and every month she earns PHP 10,000 from her business undertakings. In 2011, Nilda joined GDMPC. She has requested 30,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. When all of these animals are grown, Nilda hopes to sell them at a higher price to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sodnompil

texts.en:
Sodnompil is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Tosontsengel soum in the Zavhan province. His wife has just given a birth to a child and so far is staying at home and taking care of the three children. He has been running a garment retailing business for three years.
