The feed will help them fatten up and grow more quickly which will make them more profitable to sell. José is a young entrepreneur who is well-known in the area for being very responsible in his work and with his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his lost documents

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta Lorena vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada desamparados, en la provincia de San Jose, capital de Costa Rica. En esta zona cuenta con una amplia gama de hoteles y le ofrece al turista museos, restaurantes, parques, volcanes centros de conferencias, modernos centros comerciales, cines, teatros, galerías y mucha y variada diversión nocturna. Dentro de las principales atracciones culturales se encuentra el Teatro Nacional, situado en la Plaza de la Cultura e inaugurado en 1897, el Museo del Oro, el Museo de Arte y Diseño Contemporáneo y el Museo de los Niños. Algunas de las más famosas fiestas y celebraciones de la provincia de San José son las fiestas populares de fin y principio de cada año, el Festival de La Luz, en el mes de diciembre y la exposición nacional de orquídeas, en el mes de marzo.

Marta Lorena se dedica desde hace siete años a la sastrería, ya que es modista profesional. Ha sentido un gran apoyo por parte de su familia y los vecinos de la comunidad. Ella desea hacer crecer su negocio, para asi tener más ingresos económicos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Marta Lorena está solicitando el monto de 100,000.00 (cien mil colones), para la compra de mercadería para su taller entre ellos materiales como telas, hilos y elásticos, ya que quiere continuar dando el mejor servicio de sastrería de su comunidad y asi obtener más clientes.

Marta Lorena es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Rincón Grande S.A, este será su cuarto préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena lives with her family in a community called "Desamparados" in the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica. In this area there are a wide range of hotels and the zone offers tourist museums, restaurants, parks, volcanos, conference centers, modern malls, movies, theatres, galleries, and a lot of variety and fun nightlife. Among the main cultural attractions is the Teatro Nacional (National Theatre), located in the Plaza de la Cultura (Plaza of culture) which was inagurated in 1897, el Museo de Oro (the Gold Museum), el Museo de Arte y Diseño Contemporáneo (the Museum of Art and Contemporary Design), and el Museo de los Niños (the Children's Museum). 

Some of the most famous parties and celebrations in the province of San José are the popular parties at the end and the beginning of each year, el Festival de La Luz (the Festival of Light) in the month of December, and the national orchid exposition in the month of March.

Marta Lorena has been dedicated to her work as a tailor for 7 years. She is a professional dressmaker. She has felt great support from her family and  neighbors in the community. She wishes to make her business grow, in order to have more economic income and to provide a better quality of life to her family.

For this reason, Marta Lorena is requesting the amount of 100,000.00 colones ($200USD), in order to buy the materials for her shop, including items like fabrics, threads, and elastics, since she wants to continue giving the best tailoring service to her community and thus obtain more clients.

Marta Lorena is a member of the communal banking group Rincón Grande S.A. This will be her fourth loan, and she is very grateful for the opportunities of access to credit that the group provides so that she can carry out her life's projects.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Isabel está formado por  seis mujeres emprendedoras,  decidieron nombrarse así porque todas viven en esa área.
Dentro de las integrantes se encuentra Noemi de 41 años, quien está casada y tiene 3 hijos (18, 13,9) que están estudiando;  ella dedica a la venta de manzanas, bombones y chocolates.  Comenzó en el negocio hace tres años a causa de los problemas de salud de su esposo y debía generar ingresos para  mantener a su familia y ser el pilar de su hogar; aunado a esto, por temas de salud de uno de sus hijos necesitaba comprar más medicamento.
El sueño de Noemi es vender mucha mercancía para poder rentar un local en el que pueda establecerse mejor, contar con publicidad (ya que actualmente no tiene), darse a conocer en otros estados del país; con su meta alcanzada ella podrá asegurar el futuro de su familia y proveer estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 'Santa Isabel' group is made up of six entrepreneurial women.  They decided to give their group this name because they all live in the area of the same name.

One of the group's members is 41-year-old Noemi who is married and has three children (18, 13 and 9) who are all studying.  Her business is selling candied apples, sweets and chocolates. She started out in this business three years ago as her husband was suffering health problems.  She managed to make enough income to support her household and become the pillar of her family.  However, one of her children also suffered health problems and she needed to buy more medicines.

Noemi's dream is to sell a lot of merchandise so that she can rent premises in which to better establish her business.  She would also like to market her business (she currently doesn't have any publicity) and become known in other states.  With her goal achieved, she will be able to guarantee her family's future and provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Canti

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from E-loading and frozen foods.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like slippers, toys and other dry goods. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, toys and other dry goods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has been running the sari sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and peanuts.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 26 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her general store.

Ruby has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. She aspires to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rufio

texts.en: This time Rufio is borrowing Php 25,000 to fund his livestock business. The livestock business that he previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide him and his family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed, hogs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn, 46, is widowed and resides with a daughter in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and vegetables to sell for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory and earns about USD 4 per day. 

Due to their present house being too old, Yoeurn wants to repair it to make it stronger and bigger in order to provide better living conditions for the family. With this goal in mind, Yoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase timbers for repairing her house. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase timbers for repairing her house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her general store.

Rita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, detergents and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her community. In the future, Rachelle would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Lwanzo », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 38  ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 6  jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous avec l’appui d’un organisme de charité DON BOSCO. Elle est vendeuse de boissons.  Il y a  16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 casiers de Primus, aigle, Fanta,  etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et acheter une parcelle puis y construire une maison pour ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. En  distance, il y a un enfant derrière les membres du groupe qui était de passage lors de la photographie.
texts.en:
The client is the Lwanzo group's leader. She is a 38-year-old entrepreneur who lives alone and is the mother of 6 young children, who all go to school thanks to the support of the Don Bosco charity.

She sells drinks and has been doing this type of revenue-generating activity for 16 years. She has just received her 3rd loan, which should serve to buy 4 cases of drinks like Primus, Aigle, Fanta, etc. She would also like to see her children grow up comfortably, expand her business and buy a plot of land on which she will then build a house for her children. 

The customer thanks Hekima for it's support of poor women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

Note: in the background, behind the group members, is a small child who happened to be walking past when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy 4 cases of drinks like Primus, Aigle, Fanta, etc.

loans.name: Marlne

texts.en: Marlne is 66 years old. She is a mother of 4 children who are all enrolled in school. She has been making andazi for 1 year. With the loan she will buy more baking powder and sugar to make more andazi. She plans to pay school fees for the children as well as to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking powder to make andazi.

loans.name: Sukhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbat, 31, makes work clothes in his tailoring shop. He lives with his wife and his 2 children in the slum district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his shop for 5 years nonstop, and before that he used to work as a sewer in other tailoring companies. 

At first he started his business alone with just 2 sewing machines and some other old equipment, but now his tailoring shop has 4 employees who are hired workers. Sukhbat always wants to expand and improve his business day by day. 

At this time he wants to purchase new equipment for his shop, such as a button-machine. He thinks it will ease their jobs and their output will be notably increased. Therefore, he will use his loan to cover the cost of a button-machine to ease his tailoring jobs.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a button-machine to ease his tailoring jobs.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 37 years old and has 4 children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Jacqueline has been selling a variety of products for the last 5 years. With the loan she would like to buy more rice, sugar and maize flour for sale in the shop.  She hopes to use the profits to pay school fees and to renovate the house.  In the future, she would like to continue expanding her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr: Madame Madame est une femme de 41 ans qui habite dans l’une des banlieues du territoire sénégalais. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et gère une cantine au marché de sa localité ou elle vend des légumes et autres condiments divers. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité  et a pour objectif la diversification de ses sources de  revenus. Elle est sociétaire au sein d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis8 mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs. Son crédit a un double objet. Une partie du financement sera utilisée  pour la réfection de sa cantine et  l’autre partie servira à s’approvisionner en légumes pour les besoins de son commerce. Ce  financement  pourra l’aider a améliorer son cadre de travail et accroitre ses bénéfices en vue d’un meilleur soutien envers son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Marame is 41 years old and lives in one of Senegal's suburbs. She works in the commercial sector, running a small shop at her local market, where she sells vegetables and various condiments. She chose her line of work out of necessity and aims to diversify her revenue sources.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch for 8 months and is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs. The purpose of her loan is twofold; part of the loan will be used to repair her small shop, and part of it will be used to buy vegetables for her business. This loan could help her improve her working environment and increase her profits, with a view to better supporting her husband with the meeting of their children's needs.

loans.use: to repair her small shop and buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad  is a 26 year old married man from Gaza.  In 2008, Ahmad started working as a tailor in his own small shop.   He hopes to get this loan in order to buy new sewing machines for his shop. He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for the shop

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married, and has six children. He has been an owner of a workshop where he has been repairing cars since 2002. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Safaa is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, who are all studying. He’s more than happy to be supportive and helpful to his family, even though he’s working hard and nonstop. Wassim has many years of experience in the agriculture field and started to work on his own tractor in 1995. 

Today, he seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his tractor. He notes that this will allow him to carry on his work properly.  In the future, he plans to buy land and improve his cultivation.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his tractor.

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daysi, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, pupusas y comida, vive con su esposo y una nieta, tiene aproximadamente 25 años de estar en el negocio, lo aprendió por su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de cocina, para elaborar los productos, condimentos, maíz, aceite, pollo, chicharrón, carnes, tomates, cebollas, gas, entre otros que son muy necesarios para mejorar y aumentar la producción.
El objetivo de Daysi es mejorar y mantener el negocio por un largo tiempo, mejorando los ingresos y que su familia tenga una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Daysi's business is selling soft drinks, pupusas and other food.  She lives with her husband and a granddaughter.  She has been in her business for approximately 25 years and learned from her family.

Daysi is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her food: seasonings, corn, oil, chicken, chicharrón (fried pork rinds), meat, tomatoes, onions, gas and other products that she needs to improve and increase her production.

Daysi's goal is to improve and maintain her business over the long term, improving her income and providing her family with a more stable life.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, corn, oil, chicken, chicharrón and meat

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife. He’s the main source of income for his family and is looking to have children. 

Mahmoud has owned a truck for the past ten years. His job consists of transporting products from town to town upon customers’ requests.  Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his truck in addition to painting it. This will definitely facilitate his transportation and allow him to collect higher income. In the future, he plans to buy another truck and hire someone to work with him.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his truck in addition to painting it.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her clothes-selling business. With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Firass

texts.en:
Firass is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single and has two children.

Firass is an owner of a food market since 2000.  He sells items like soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has tremendous experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He enjoys a good reputation and his food market is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1200 loan in order to paint his market’s walls and to add more food to his inventory.  With this loan, he is hoping to gain more profits, that will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to paint his food market and buy additional inventory.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has three children.

Safaa is a copier and typist.  In 2008, he opened his own shop.  He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and his services are well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $1800 in order to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors and to add more shelves.  He is hoping to gain more profits which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: In order to repair and fix his shop.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and four children.  He’s considered to be the main source of income in the family and is working really hard to provide a better future for his children. 

He started his own metal work nine years ago and is looking forward to growing his business. He works independently, on a free-lance basis.  Today, he has the intention of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added metal supplies. He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to expand his business and open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase added metal supplies

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  est âgée  de 35ans et évolue dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle exerce l’achat et la vente de légumes et céréales. Elle a choisi son  activité par nécessité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-MCEC et a déjà remboursé 2 crédits  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt  de 100 000 frs prévu pour  l’aménagement de l’endroit ou elle exerce son activité d’une part et d’autre part  pour l’achat de céréales et légumes destinés a la vente. ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama is 35 years old and works in commerce. She buys and sells vegetables and cereals. She chose her line of work out of necessity, with the aim of earning an income.

Mariama is a member of a UIMCEC branch and has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is requesting a 100 000 franc loan, to be used in part to fit out her place of business, and in part to buy cereals and vegetables destined for resale. This loan will enable her to better develop her sales business, increase her profits and better support her husband with the management of the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to repair her place of business, and buy cereals and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. Enrique es casado, es de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 2 hijos. El se dedica  a la fábrica de cerámica-olería en su propia casa, vende  a clientes ocasionales y por pedido.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que todo el trabajo que hace es por darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que se conviertan en grandes profesional. Su meta es trabajar y de esa forma seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales y herramientas para usar en su olería, ya que este es su medio de trabajo y de subsistencia, de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Enrique is from the city of Encarnación.  He is married and has two children.  He makes ceramic bricks at his house.  He sells to occasional customers and by order.  He is a very hard-working and enterprising person.  

He says that all of the work he does is to give his children the best and so that they can become great professionals.  His goal is to work, to continue growing, and to continue helping his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy materials and tools to use with his brick oven.  This is his means of work and subsistence for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools to use with his brick oven.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit was born in 1959. She lives in Ijevan with her husband and a daughter, who is a student of Yerevan State University Ijevan branch. Anahit’s husband works as an engineer. Anahit worked as an operator for many years, but in 1997 she decided to run her own business.

Anahit rents a stall in the market, where she sells women's and children's clothes and also children’s shoes. Once a week she and her colleagues from the market, rent a car and go to Yerevan, where they buy merchandise for their business. Thanks to her business income, Anahit is able to provide for her family’s needs and to pay for her daughter’s education at the University. Also, Ahanit was able to repair her apartment and to buy necessary furniture for it. This is Anahit’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed repayment on her loans. Now, she is requesting a 700.000 AMD loan to buy an assortment of Spring woman’s and children’s clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy Spring clothing for resale.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, one of whom is working and the other is still attending school. Like every couple, Antoine and his wife wish to offer a respectable life to their children.  For this reason, they combine forces to be able to cover the heavy life expenses. 

Antoine opened his own butchery in 1980. He’s a reputable person and always searches to deliver good and fresh products. Today, he’s wishing to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the needed quantity of meat for his butchery. In that way, he will be capable of developing his business and augmenting his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of meat for his butchery.

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her oldest child is 3 years old. Junalyn's husband works as a sales clerk.

Junalyn has been in the business of raising hogs for 2 years. She earns about 6000 php per month. Junalyn works hard to take care of her children and manage her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins.  Junalyn hopes this loan will help improve her business. She is planning to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her clothes selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands. The loans have improved her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 35-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband has been working as a fireman for the past 22 years in order to enhance their way of living. 

As for Heba, she has had her own home business as a private teacher since 2003. At the same time, she has been working as a teacher in a local school. 

Today, Heba’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to change her teaching room’s decoration in addition to painting. She notes that this will improve her way of teaching and allow her to attract additional students. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to change her teaching room’s decoration in addition to painting.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He’s the one taking care of his family and supporting them.  

Ahmad has owned a bakery in his town since 2008. At the same time, he has been working on his taxi business in his free time. 

Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase raw materials for his bakery. He notes that this will speed up his productivity and therefore increase his profits. 

In the future, Ahmad plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca  es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casada tiene 4 hijos. Es por ellos que ella se sacrifica, para darles lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa en su ropa, trabaja por pedido y cliente ocasionales de la ciudad y de su barrio. Tiene muy buenos trabajos y es por ello que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, por lo que tiene buenos ingresos. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando en su taller. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Francisca is from the city of Encarnación.  She is married and has four children.  It is for the children that she makes sacrifices.  She does this in order to give them what they need for a decent life without deprivations.

She devotes herself to making clothes.  She works by order and occasional customers in the city and in her neighborhood.  She does very good work, and that is why she already has a well-formed clientele.  Therefore, she has good income.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and the other supplies she needs to be able to continue working in her shop.  She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady est une dame de 50 ans qui est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet, 16. C’est aussi une ancienne cliente du guichet et elle a eu à bénéficier de 3 crédits au sein de cette même institution. Elle est marchande, et a acquis une expérience de  près de 15 ans dans ce domaine qui consiste à aller acheter des marchandises (tissus, sacs à main, chaussures...). Pour cela, elle s’approvisionne en dehors du pays dans un pays limitrophe du Sénégal : la Gambie. 
Khady n’a pas de charge mais travaille à diversifier ses produits et services et à améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Khady is a 50-year old married lady who has four children - the eldest of whom is 22 and the youngest is 16. She is a former customer of the branch and has benefited from 3 loans from this institution. She is a trader and has gained almost 15 years experience in this field that consists of going to buy goods (textiles, handbags, shoes ...). To do this, she sources her goods from a country neighbouring Senegal: The Gambia.
Khady does not have anyone to support but works to diversify her products and services and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy various goods in the Gambia (textiles, handbags, shoes) for resale in Senegal

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, su clima cálido, así como también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo por la generosidad de sus pobladores y su buena sazón para la preparación de platillos, es por ello que en especial uno de los platos favoritos de Luis es la riquísima “Carapulcra”; uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es jugar futbol en especial cuando se siente desanimado o tiene alguna preocupación.

Luis trabaja como albañil,  le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas diarias, es un trabajo muy duro pero él lo realiza con muchas ganas por ello el cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que sus clientes se sientes satisfechos con su labor y lo recomiendan.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá darle mantenimiento a vehículo en el cual transporta los materiales que utiliza así como también para comprar herramientas y materiales para la realización de su trabajo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para transportar sus herramientas y ya no tener que alquilar movilidad ni tampoco herramientas, así seguirá luchando cada día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño.” Tener una empresa de construcción”.
texts.en:
Luis, age 55, is from the city of Chincha.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches and its warm climate.  It is also known for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Above all, it is known for the generosity of its people and for the great seasoning used in food preparation.  One of Luis’s favorite dishes is the delicious “Carapulcra” (a spicy Peruvian stew).  One of his favorite pastimes is playing soccer, especially when he is downhearted or worried.

Luis works as a bricklayer, and he works around ten hours a day.  It is very hard work, but he does it with great devotion.  Therefore, he believes that his business is going well for him.  His customers are happy with his work, and they recommend him.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their support he will be able to perform maintenance on the vehicle he uses to transport the materials he uses.  He will also buy tools and materials to do his work.  This will allow him to have a vehicle that is in good shape for transporting his tools.  He will no longer have to rent a vehicle or tools.

This way he will continue struggling each day in order to be able to fulfill his big dream of,  “Having a construction company”.

loans.use: to buy tools and perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: Monsieur Thierno est âgé de 29 ans, il est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfant. Il est commerçant et gérant d’une boutique depuis 2006. Dans laquelle il vend des denrées alimentaires telles que des pates, du lait, du beurre, du chocolat, du vinaigre et divers autres  marchandises qui entrent dans le panier de la ménagère. Le crédit va lui permettre de  renouveler son stock pour  pouvoir satisfaire la demande qui augmente. Thierno va acheter  une tonne de riz et  un fut d’huile. Avec son bénéfice il gère sa petite famille et arrive à mettre un peu d’argent de coté ; de ce fait il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer.
texts.en: Monsieur Thierno is 29 years old. He is married but does not have any children yet. He is a trader and has been managing a shop since 2006. His shop sells foodstuffs such as pasta, milk, butter, chocolate, vinegar and other types of goods that make their way into the baskets of housekeepers. The loan will enable him to replenish his stock in order to meet increasing demand. Thierno will buy a ton of rice and a vat of oil. He will use his earnings to support his family and to put some money aside; this will help him improve the living conditions of his home.

loans.use: To buy rice and oil to sell in his shop

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur Libasse est âgé de 34 ans. Il vit au Sénégal et est plombier de profession. Il  a choisi son métier dans le souci de se procurer  des revenus afin  de subvenir a ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour le préfinancement d’un marché qu’il a gagné. Les financements qui lui sont octroyés par l’institution lui permettent de bien gérer les marchés qu’il engage, d’accroitre ses revenus réguliers, d’améliorer son niveau de vie et de mieux prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en: Monsieur Libasse is 34 years old. He lives in Senegal and is a plumber by trade. He chose this job as he needed to raise revenues in order to meet his personal needs and the needs of his family. He is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC and has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 75,000 frs so that he can pre-finance a contract that he has won. The loans that have been granted to him by the institution enable him to better manage his contracts, increase his regular income, improve his living standards and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to pre-finance a contract

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 25-year-old lady who is married to Mikson, a 30-year-old man. They are blessed with a son namely, Grevando, 1 year old. 

Maria owns an internet cafe business; she has been running the business for three years. The business is operated from 8 am to 11 pm. Maria employs two assistants to monitor the business alternately. Maria’s business is running well so the profit generated was enough to support her to start up a kiosk business at her residence a month ago. 

Maria desires to complete the stock at her kiosk. She would like to buy coffee, sugar, milk, bath soap, cigarettes, snacks and soft drinks but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. Maria is hoping that TLM will assist her in improving her business through the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such coffee, sugar, milk, bath soap, cigarettes, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is taking another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her clothes selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 36-year-old farmer who is married to Meriana, a 36-year-old lady. Ayub and Meriana are blessed with two children from their marriage, namely: Fenny, 14,  who is studying in the 2nd grade of Junior High School, and Ferdy, 11, who is studying at the 4th grade of Elementary School.

Ayub has been a farmer for years. From the job, Ayub is able to earn income to finance his children's schooling costs and households needs. He cultivates vegetables such as mustard greens, water spinach, tomatoes and cucumber at his farm. Ayub is lucky since his neighbor allows him to utilize part of the field to cultivate paddy. The income from the harvest will be shared equally with the landlord.
 
At the end of January Ayub spent his capital to plant rice and to buy the fertilizer. He plans to continue cultivating vegetables but he needs more money to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. Therefore he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. Ayub is hoping that TLM will help him through the loan assistance for his business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba es âgée  de 44ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle gère u ne boutique de commerce de détail de produits cosmétiques a la devanture de sa maison.  C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis 2 mois. Elle sollicite un prêt de 75 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux produits a  revendre. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre  ses bénéfices et d’améliorer son niveau de vie ainsi que celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba is 44 years old and lives in Senegal. She runs a shop selling cosmetics at the front of her house. She chose this business out of necessity.

Coumba has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch for 2 months. She is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs in order to buy new products for resale. This loan will enable her to increase her profits and improve her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Sihame

texts.en: Sihame is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and four school-aged children. She collaborates with her husband to meet the family demands. Her husband has been working with his own van since the year 2000. As for her, she has two years of experience in selling home products and has her own shop.  Today, she’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added products such as Tupperware plastics and many other items in order to diversify her sales and gain a new range of customers, which will surely increase her profits. In the future, she plans to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase added products such as Tupperware and many other items to diversify her sales

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en: Maysaa is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Three of her children are still attending school and the other one is working. Her husband is the main income provider in the family; he’s working outside the country at a local company. As for her, she opened her own lingerie shop in 2008. She has loyal customers and knows very well how to stay in good relations with them. She is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie and many other items.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop to include women's clothing.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie and may other items

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She strives to work really hard to help her husband with their family expenses. She has been working as a clothes seller from her home since the year 2000. In parallel, she also works in a lingerie shop. As for her husband, he works as a taxi driver on a free-lance basis. 

Today, Fatmeh wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of clothes. This loan will increase her sales therefore her profits thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of meat for his butchery

loans.name: Wafik

texts.en: Wafik is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s trying his best to satisfy his family's needs and provide help whenever they need it. He has been working as a plumber and painter since 1995. He works independently and visits his customers at home from time to time. He is looking to borrow money from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new painting tools and some plumbing equipment.  This will help him take on more projects and gain more customers. In the future, he plans to improve his job and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy new painting tools and some plumbing equipment

loans.name: Laura Julissa

texts.es:
Laura una mujer de 32 años, es casada y tiene un pequeño de apenas 2 años, está muy contenta con su pequeña familia y el empeño que tienen ambos en sacar a esta nueva familia adelante. Actualmente su esposo es obrero de packing, actividad que le permite apoyar y mucho a Laura en los ingresos del hogar. 

Para salir adelante Laura tuvo la buena idea de iniciar una pequeña bodega, donde se dedicaría a la venta de todo tipo de productos comestibles a sus vecinos, es de esta manera como empezó en este tipo de negocio, al cual le dedica medio día debido a que también trabaja con una señora a la cual ayuda en su tienda.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Laura desea poder comprar productos líquidos, como gaseosas, re hidratantes, agua, etc. por temporada de verano, está muy contenta con esta nueva idea porque sabe que con el transcurso del tiempo y mejora de sus ingresas podrá crear un Mini market y luego de eso desea poder ponerlo en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Laura, 32, is married and has a 2-year old son.  She is very happy with her little family and works hard to support them.  Her husband works as a laborer and the couple share household expenses.  

Laura operates a corner shop where she sells all kinds of everyday products.  She started it because she needed a way to generate an income.  She works half of each day, sharing the running of the shop with another woman who works the other half.  

With help from Kiva lenders, Laura will stock her store with the products that her customers most want in summer--soft drinks, etc.  She is very happy with her progress and is confident that she will eventually be able to build a larger business.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Elva Francisca

texts.es:
Elba es una mujer de 53 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida.

Su historia empezó desde 6 a 5 años atrás en su casa en horas de la tarde y ahora también vende los fines de semana en las mañanas es lo único que sabe saber, su trabajo lo hace sola el horario es de martes a viernes de 18:00 hasta las 22:00, sábado y domingo 6:00 hasta 13:00, si tiene dificultades que se llegase a enfermar, si está casada el esposo es mensajero en una empresa, si tiene hijos son mayores.

Su sueño más importante es aumentar el espacio físico de su casa para poder poner mesas para los clientes. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida y asi comprar carnes, granos, vegetales  etc.
texts.en:
Elba is a 53 year old woman who has many aspirations to prosper with her food sales business.

The story of her business began between 5 and 6 years ago at her home in the afternoons.  She also sells food on weekends in the morning.  It is all she knows.  She works alone and her schedule is from Tuesday to Friday 6 to 10pm, and Saturday and Sunday from 6am to 1pm.  If she has difficulties and gets sick, she has the advantage of a husband that works as a messenger for a company.  She has older sons as well.

Her most important dream is to expand the physical space in her house so that she can put out tables for the clients.  That is why she wants she wants this loan, for her food sale business, and through this to be able to buy meat, grains, and vegetables, etc.

loans.use: buy meat, grains, and vegetables.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are still studying. She is cooperating with her husband in order to satisfy their needs and be capable to live as they are. She has owned a clothing shop since 2004 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added clothing such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items. She notes that this loan will push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open other branches.

loans.use: to purchase added clothing such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items.

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en:
Didacienne is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil. 

Didacienne is requesting a loan to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. She plans to build a house from the profits.

loans.use: tp purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s doing his best to be able to offer them a respectable life. He opened his own car oil and batteries shop in 2009 and has a variety of products. He also sells different types of tires. Today, he’s looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries in addition to tires for his business. He notes that this will boost his sales and allow him earn superior income. In the future, he plans to better develop his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. To cover the heavy costs of life, they’re both joining forces in order to meet at least their necessary expenses. His wife has been working as a babysitter for fifteen years. As for him, he has been working in selling oil to the neighboring areas. 

Today, Houssam is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of oil for his business.  He really wishes a better future for his children and he thinks that this Kiva loan will increase his profits thus enhance his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open his own oil shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of oil for his business
